text:
Asian buffet, slightly above average in all aspects.

Buffet At Asia is an Asian buffet restaurant, priced cheaper than most casino buffets (around $16 for dinner) though there are Asian buffets that are cheaper still.

There is decent variety of foods and there is also a Mongolian grill (or bbq) where you can select the ingredients you want and they're cooked live in front of you.

I won't comment on the seafood as I don't eat any but there were crab legs and sushi options. 
For meat lovers there was pork, chicken and beef, around 3 choices for each. All were decent tasting though they were a bit oil/fat-heavy. All of them tasted average, not bad but also not special, about the same you'd expect from any takeout.

I really enjoyed the sweet sesame balls (essentially dough balls covered in sesame and deep fried) though they were kind of heavy on the stomach.

There's also a large variety of vegetables, steamed or fried and I also saw frog legs! (for those who consider it a delicacy, I don't)

The desserts station had a large variety of fruit (quite refreshing from the usual buffet "cheesecake and carrotcake" staples) as well as soft serve ice cream, donuts (not the usual style but a deep fried style I didn't really enjoy, too oily and crispy with a sour/stale taste) and cakes.

Something that I found odd (even mildly annoying) was that there weren't descriptions/names in all of the foods, and those that had any description it was just written with a permanent marker on the glass above. It would cost nothing to print some nice readable labels and it would really change the image of the buffet and inform customers what every food is.

Service was fast (the place was not crowded at all when I visited) but one of the servers was.. weird (in a good way). She didn't speak much, she would just stand in front of you looking down instead of asking if you wanted a refill. Now that led to somewhat eerie moments of silence while attempting to establish communication (having someone stand silently in front of you and you saying "coke please" just seemed weird and rude). I assume she was just shy and maybe new at the job and I'm not going to mark them down for that.

There's also a sign on the wall that says there's an extra charge for wasted food. While this is understandable in a manner that someone who fills their plate with one type of food and doesn't eat it will cause the restaurant to throw it away, it may also put off people from trying new things thinking that if they don't like something or can't eat it they'll have to pay extra. I haven't encountered such a situation and hopefully the restaurant will be prudent but still the sign on the wall exudes a passive threat.

Overall, Buffet At Asia manages to be slightly above average in everything: price, food selection, taste (some foods tend to be heavy/oily), service. Hence 3/5

i used to come to this place once a week because the price for a buffet was about $10. I came in one day around 3:30pm. And i was going to pay with my card. But this chinese lady that works there told me that there card machine didnt work. i had like 12-$13 of cash that time and she was charging me almost $20 for a DINNER Buffet! and I'm like WHAT i came in for a lunch buffet, and she was like "the computer system already change for dinner" " i dont know how to change it back so i have to ring you up for a dinner buffet" and im like are you serious? i even told her why would i even pay for a dinner buffet if i'm not even going to eat any seafood? and she looks at me like Im stupid. C'Mon now DINNER doesnt even start till like 4-5pm. What an IDIOT!  This place is a joke never go here bad customer service and foods are not even that good! i just go there before for the ox tail soup other than that food is a 3/10 in my book!

I wasn't overly excited to go here, at first, but my boyfriend insisted that it was tasty. I was pleasantly surprised. 

Highlights:

1) Large population of Asian people eating at Buffet At Asia - always a good sign.

2) Healthy-ish options like Mongolian BBQ, Snow crab legs, fruit, salad, surprisingly good sushi, steamed prawns and more.

3) Tasty hot and sour soup (not always the case at Chinese restaurants, let alone all you can eat bbqs)

Lowlights:

1) Questionably clean dishes. They were mostly clean with a few notable aberrations.

2) Limited, gelatinous dessert selection (though I didn't see the ice cream until it was too late).

Overall, I am impressed that I liked the food, I don't feel sick after eating there, and it was only $15. I'll return.
Waiting line is long and food are ok if you like regular chinese food.  I think nothing special.

So bad I am calling the health department! It's hot and humid in here - and the place is filthy. The floors are beyond dirty,- food stations filthy - and clear that this place is fallen below any sort of safety standard. The manager doesn't speak English and seems non responsive to pointing out areas of improvement. The staff couldn't be any worse too. Terribly disgusted and dissapointed. Do not eat here!
Someone please tell them to throw away food that has gone bad.  You know the food is old when it's changing color, or hard as a ROCK and your FORK bends.

The worst service ever. Even nobody came to take our plates, we had maybe 7 or 8 plate on the table. And when we wanted to pay with credit card, the owner or manager told us no credit card accept, very rude!
I will definitely not come to this restaurant any more!

I've been here several times, I can say the food it's good but sometimes they take a long time to refill the trays. also they should have more variety on the buffet and every day it's basically the same food.

Buffet of Asia is one of the top ten Asian buffet in LV. If U don't want to pay astronomical prices for seafood buffets on the strip. Then this place will be your best bet for Alaskan King crab legs n oyster on a half shell craze. Dinner seafood buffet is  $15. Soft drinks cost U extra $2. But there is always the option for tap water! Like all Asian eatery. The customer service can be a hit or miss. But U will be too full to the brim to give a f*ck!

This place has some nerve. Last Friday I went to enjoy their lobster and paid their full dinner price. There was a sign above the lobster which stated to take only three pieces. People were lined up and 1 person took almost the entire pan. They put out such a small pan of lobster, and when we complained, we were told that the lobster was an appetizer only. It takes the kitchen staff to refill the lobster 20 minutes at a time. I thought this was an " all you can eat buffet " but apparently not. The spareribs were hard as a rock and dry, and their chow mein was stale. I cant believe the health department gave this place an A+.  I have seen these people put old food on top of new food, and they clean their floors with a towel right on top of their patrons. The health department must be made aware of this place, as well as who is in charge of buffets in town. This place is violating all the rules!
4 years later, this place is still terrible. Why my mom likes to go here, ill never understand.

Atmosphere: Nice small restaurant, it looks bigger than it really is. 

Service: Typical from a buffet. Nothing special, but nothing to complain about either.

Food: So they have the Sirloin Steak and Lamb Chops that you can order. We waited for 30 mins to finally get them, and they were super thin, and super overcooked, nothing like the pictures. lol, they never are. 
The buffet itself is pretty decent.  A good variety.  Loved the crab legs.  Loved the shrimp.  Loved the barbecued fish.
An okay mongolian barbecue grill, but you're not allowed to put in the sauce yourself, they mix it for you.  

Bottom Line:
Buffet food is pretty good.  Don't recommend the side Sirloin Steak or the Lamb Chop.  Wished they allowed you to mix your own sauce.  Other than that not a bad deal.
This place's got everything. As a Chinese person, the flavors are great. For the price, it has great variety and lots of seafood. Enjoy!

I came with a tourist group and it was highly recommended by our guide. They charged $12 per person for a weekday lunch, which l later realized was way higher than the regular price they charge walk ins. While most people in my tourist group don't speak English and were foreign tourists, I am not and I for sure didn't want to be treated like an idiot who just paid his bill without asking. No price posted anywhere and front desk even lied to me that $12 is the regular price they charge other customers. I figured out myself later that they included generous tips in this $12 price. As a matter of fact, I did not get any service during my stay and I had to get my own drinks, so why I had to pay tips for missing service? In addition, what made this price fishy is the guy who collected payment at the front desk told me that I have to pay cash or I have to pay additional for tips? Why??? Is it due to the fact that you are trying to report business loss to IRS and "smartly" avoid paying tax on this? If there is a way, I would write a letter to IRS and report their suspicious conduct. Needless to say, the food looked and tasted like trash, unwashed and deep fried in dirty oil or mixed with all kinds of MSG. If you are looking for a value meal, don't come here! If you are looking for high quality food, don't come here! If you care about service, don't come here (seemed to me that the front desk did not know English at all). For all means, avoid this buffet at all possibilities, if you don't want to be ripped off and get diarrhea after.

I have not gone to the restaurant but had a bad experience with them.. We were on tour through Chinese tour bus.. They stopped here for lunch.. We went to target to have pizza at cafe for brunch.. I happened to get my kid diaper changed .. When I asked to permit me to the bathroom .. They started saying NO NO NO NO.. They told that I can't use the bathroom until I become a customer .. It's really awkward .. In US I hav seen all people to be courteous and generous.. But these ppl are more of a business minded.. Hate the management.. They didn't say a word of SORRY OR PLEASE.. I think there is some ethics to even reply

Stay away from this buffet!
 We came here with the tour bus...my father eat an broccoli and he found out the vegetable had an huge mosquito... I informed the cashier and she said she would ask the kitchen..Finally, she went back to the cashier without any explanations...bad services..

There were different types of sushi but none of them seemed fresh at all. Honestly, I'd trust Walmart sushi over this. Not a lot of selection either. Didn't see any of the crab legs or nigiri that they advertised. Not that I expected any after reading these reviews. 

They also used plastic plates and forks/spoons. Just try harder guys.

Ugh.   After passing this location in Henderson numerous times we have finally decided to go there yesterday for the Lunch buffet.  Ugh again!   Plates were dirty.  One after another, after another.  Rice, sauce, etc.  At one time I put 6 dirty dishes off to the side so that no one else would take them.

The floors were absolutely filthy!  My wife and I didn't think this was worth it so we left our food on the table and left.  We made a comment to the lady at the register and she was clearly indifferent to what we said.

I have read that the other locations had good reviews so perhaps one day we may try one of those.

In an area where Chinese Buffets are few and far between it was very disappointing to come across this.

Pretty good place! The girl in the front was really nice, and I suppose the whole staff too. I got the buffet to go and it was nice because you could get everything you want in the container for $8.75! The food is really basic though, like how a buffet should be. Just some food to get you full, although some of the entrees were a little dry. Overall it was good!

We have eaten at this location a couple of times, but yesterday was the worse. Very basic things wrong here. They had a lot of staff out on the floor and they all looked mad. We had a hard time communicating with our waitress. We were just asking for some ice. They have tables crowded in and there is a couple places where only one person can pass and the staff walks very slowly in front of customers and cutting them off. The floors were not clean. It didn't look like they had cleaned between lunch and dinner. They were out of several items as soon as they sat them out, because they allowed people to mound their plates with oyster, crabs or lobster...though there was a line of people waiting for them. I know it isn't 100% their fault, but they can manage that better. While we were sitting at our table one of the waitress came over and took our salt and pepper, never got them back. Then someone else came in...may have been a manager and proceeded to speak loudly with one of the waitresses in the middle of the restaurant while pointing at a pepper shaker on another table. The food was decent, nothing was a great standout. This isn't what I am use to with Buffet Asia. There is usually a couple things that are really good.

This place is horrible. Saturday evening me, me husband and my kids were very ill after eating at "Buffet @ Asia" I was the sickest of all because I ate Sushi. I do not want anyone else to feel like this, so stay away from this place unless you want to waste two days on a shiny toilet seat.

Overall Rating: - 1 star  
Food: -1 star  
Customer Service:  2 star Staff NOT friendly  
Seating Area: 1 star  Seated at....DIRTY table & CHAIRS with discarded food on floor throughout site 
Buffet Area:  - 1 star   Food Trays/ Warming Tray Containers contained other food dishes spilled over, Ice Cream/Yogurt Spillover Tray was FLITHY and contained DISCARDED cones and dark product spillover 

Totally regret taking out of town visitors there.

Ate at the location on Eastern & Flamingo yesterday (Sunday). I eat at many asian buffets, so I know what to expect.

Here's my honest take:

Pros: 
-Decent selection of food

-Server was friendly and attentive

-Gyoza dumplings, Wonton soup, Jalapeno chicken was really good, pretty decent quality fruit - seemed fresh.

Cons:
-Sign claims to have "Thai, japanese, chinese, american etc" all different types of cuisine - the only Thai dish they had was Pad Thai, and it was of really poor quality. The sushi was kinda gross, too. They only really had chinese, and some cheap pizza for the kids.
 
-Restaurant in general has a "dirty" feel to it. I was afraid to touch anything. I ate finger foods with my fork to avoid getting sick. It was really busy, but it didn't seem like they were keeping up with the crowds very well as far as cleanliness goes.

-Bathrooms were filthy, totally trashed. I saw an employee go in to clean, but she wasn't wiping up the mess, just spraying disinfectant randomly and emptying trash.

-The grossest thing about this location were the customers - REALLY filthy people. Waiting in line to get in, a man in front of us had *KILLER* B.O. - the kind legends are made of. It smelled like he hadn't washed his ass for a month! It kinda sucked to have to experience that right before eating. The people sitting near us seemed dirty and trashy too. I know the proprietors of the restaurant can't control this, but it ruined the experience for me.

-It was really busy, and I was nearly run over by servers, kids and fat people every 5 minutes. It was difficult to walk around with a plate of food in your hands.

I was very impressed with the value that this restaurant provides.   It was also a great venue for a family with small boys as they were able to move around.  Price was unbeatable at $12.85/adult with a large choice from the buffet:  Japanese sushi, crab legs, spicy crab, chinese dishes like spicy chicken, orange chicken, spicy string beans, a mongolian stir fry station with kalbi cooked to order, oysters on the half shell, etc   The food was pretty good on all counts-certainly wasn't Bellagio quality-but it was very tasty and an incredible value.

So cheap!!! Dinner for $15.99 and all the lobster you can eat! And it wasn't stingy lobster, lobster tails had real chunks of meat. All the other food was good too. They have oysters (cooked and raw), barbecue pork, sushi (although only okay; sashimi was okay, and so much more. They know how to salt. The Mongolian grill was interesting, the noodles dishes they make there aren't very good, but you should try the marinated spare ribs they have, and just have that. This is definitely a place to stop when we'll be coming back to Vegas. Forget Bellagio Buffet...

Never in my life have I been so dissappinted by a restaurant. It baffles me this place still has their doors open. Horrible food and selection. Everything is cold and mislabeled it is over priced and they don't even have crab crackers for the crab legs. Come on.

They even have a sign saying they'll charge for any wasted food. Which is a trap because this food is all a waste. You couldn't pay me to eat this food and I cannot believe I have to pay for this meal right now.

I would give 0 stars if possible. The place is horrible. I wouldn't even take my dog here. The floor is nastttty. The waitress was rude and when we were each ordering our drinks, she expected me to count how many cokes and how many sprites. I've never see such thing before haha. 

The bathrooms were disgusting. 

The food was not fresh at all. Not one of the dishes were above average. The rice was hard. The chicken was soggy. The best thing there was probably the watermelon. Funny because that's not something they made themselves. Not to mention the place is overpriced ($15 per person). 

I usually don't give bad reviews but this is the worst buffet I've ever been to. 

Will not come back, ever!

The place was disgustingly dirty. They sat us down next to a table that had a mountain of dishes 2 feet tall. The floor looked like they had just hosted a concert. Our table still had dirty napkins, dirty silverware, and food debris. The food wasn't anything special: very bland tasting &  greasy. It is cheaply priced though..

They have a huge selection of food but be ready for lots and lots of people at this place. We went on a Sunday for lunch at it was packed! All the items were fresh and hot. So the only real complaint was the guy who elbowed me at the entrance by accident and the general feeling of being crowded by the masses. It also was the first place I've been to in Vegas where most of the people were Asian.

$13 weekday dinner, $16 Fri-Sat, if you live in Las Vegas/Henderson watch for local coupon mailers.  Price includes soft drinks, for dinner a piece of steak, and also a mutton chop (order these from your server). Senior discount. Thai boba tea $3 extra.

Be sure and arrive at least two hours before closing for freshest food (they will be the first to tell you this).  Bus tours stop here.

Moingolian-style grill, fresh sushi.  Soups include hot & sour  and Tom Yoong.  30 or more dinner items including steamed clams, shrimp, lobster (weekends), BBQ pork.  Another 15 or so dessert items.

Unlike casino buffets you can park right outside -- there's no Bataan death march through a smoky casino to get to the buffet.

Horrible. Instead if charging kids by age, they charge by height. Kool with me. However, they dont want to charge you while you're at the front desk getting seated, the waitstaff (who barely speaks english) would seat you first, let you eat for 10mns, then ask you how many people and what are the ages of the kids. Then come this loooooong broken-english explanation of how they charge, then they ask for the height of the kids, then age again. WTF!!! Just have a damn ruler at the front and do that instead if they want to charge u by height!!! In-fact, I should get charged half price because I'm shorter than 5' !!! It took us 10 minutes to get the head count straightened out ( we had a party of 14, kids and infants included) and she would bring you the check and literally stay at the table and watched me bust out my purse to pay. This is barely 15 minutes getting seated and I literally was still chewing while she stood by after handing me the check. Rude. I could have paid first!!! 
The variety of food is lacking for a buffet. i've had better. You're better off going somewhere else. However, I did come on a weekday. 
Note: My 3 yr old son was charged $7 because when they asked me for age, I said 3 yrs old and I guess they thought I said 3 feet. LOL. Other places, he's usually free. I don't have the time to try to argue with them on that since they barely speak english.
and so we meet again.. Sushi and shashimi yammmmy.
Awful, only reason why this place is open is due to the high traffic of buses from Asia coming in! Just don't!

Got charged $13 (tax, tips included) for a lunch Buffett in this restaurant. * believe me, they cover up all price in the restaurant.* 

Choices are limited consider we came with a tour bus n this is the only restaurant that open @ 9:30 (ya, i'm aware it's official hours state 11:00).

Food: I believe most foods are left over from night before, since they come out from the kitchen with 1/3 of the regular serving.

Most dishes are either too salty or too much sauces that I can't even taste the food itself. (The place I used to work does it a lot to cover up ......... ya...)

Clams are not clean probably as there's still sand in it. 

Service: unless u carry a bill in ur hand ready to tip, otherwise, expect to do it yourself. * after all, it's only buffet... what's there to serve other than greeting & taking away the plates*


Conclusion: 
Even with the $2 off, I would still choose macdonald & in-n-out over this. Not only because of the food quality but also the service. 
 
Really surprise this place existing to such long time without anyone reporting it.

Recommend this place to ppl that may feel more comfortable dining in a Chinese speaking environment and don't mind left over ingredients/food or anyone that has relationship pricing with no expectable. 

Bon appetite!

Visited this place twice during my last visit to Vegas. 

Winners: Deep-fried calamari, tilapia fillet, seafood on toast, fried rice, tom yum goong, craw fish.

Subpar: Chow mein, Dessert selection, Snow crab legs were anorexic.

The place is clean including the restroom, seating was prompt even for a party of 8 at lunch hour, parking was OK.

Lunch buffet at 6.95 and Dinner buffet at 11.95.....I can't complain
worse. buffet. ever. do. not. go here. food quality is bad. its too expensive. floors were dirty. worse $15 i've spent in my life.

Foods filled with salt, grease and MSG. The restaurant manager was yelling at her emplyee for 5 min while we were waiting in line to enter. The floor and restrooms were all filthy. Couldn't wait to get out of this place after eating few things. 

This one star is giving to its price. It's cheap but I really don't recommend it.
horrible service!! they don't even bother to get you a drink! won't recommend to anyone

i'm a big asian buffet guy, even bad asian buffet. i live for finding the one redeeming dish while suffering through all the bad ones but i tried most everything and i couldn't find one @ this buffet. all the chicken dishes except for the wings used that slimy, rubbery, mysterious chicken you find @ bad teriyaki places. i dug the chicken wings and the shrimp but they tasted old and reheated like everything else. they hide the sushi! i dished up two plates before i saw it over there. my fault, i like to start at one end of the buffet and work my way to the other and i usually don't start @ the salad side, haw! it was typical buffet sushi, poor quality and covered in mayonnaise. i probably would have liked it more if i had started with it though. i think i'll wait 'til my bad buffet loving bros come to town to even consider hitting this place up again. the price is right though, so i'll give 'em that.

I made an act. Just so I can rate this place. 
For some reason my aunt loves this place and it gets worse every time we visit this place. They have added more chairs which make it nearly impossible walking around with your plate with out the waiters bumping into you. Cleanness is far from it. Serving spoons are not clean and used for more than one dish. Floors seem to be not mopped in days. Be careful of the ceiling fan they don't clean it and dust is clearly on it. 

Now the food. It's not bad. I mean it's the kind of food that you can tolerate to eat. But when you are done eating you feel disgusting. Disgusted that you at at this place. 

One thing about this place that I commend is the waiters though. They are poorly understaffed and they work really hard. In fact I didn't see one of them stand around.

Whatever you do - don't eat the oysters  or stay away altogether.

My son and I had early dinner here last Saturday (3/19) and I had the oysters and he didn't. 

That same evening, I was having non-stop diarrhea and 2 days after, violent vomiting. I'm still not well but self-medicating with Imodium and trying to take fiber and liquids when I can . I may go to Urgent Care tomorrow if this doesn't go away.

I had a sense this was a dodgy place but had a craving for seafood and this is close to my place and I didn't want to spend a lot. 

Serves me right but never again.

If anybody reading this has the misfortune of having a similar experience, I hope you will go to this Southern Nevada Health District link and file a complaint: http://southernnevadahealthdistrict.org/foodborne/fbi-form.php

Let's work together to make eating out a much safer and enjoyable experience for all of us. Thanks.

Probably the worst Asian buffet I've ever been to. Food was stale tasting, questionable texture of the meat items, the floors looked dirtier than a homeless persons box and the bathrooms might as well be an alley sewer drain. Who cares if its a buffet, it's still $9.50 for lunch. I've gotten more satisfaction from a lottery ticket that didn't match any numbers.
Worst restaurant ever. The food is fine, yet the staff are appearing very hostile and impatient toward the client.

If I can give this a zero star I will. Havent had chance to post my review yet since im too busy. But now I wanna say that its the worst buffet at asia I ever been too. My sister got food poisoned eating here like 2 months ago!  Had to take her to the ER and doctor said its a food poisoned , asked her what she ate and I remember the only thing we ate is at the buffet asia. I think its the bbq shortribs (cook to order) that she ate to made her felt like that. Its probably undercooked or bad already. Goodthing I didnt eat that or else will both be on ER. I would never go here again!

Avoid this place at all costs. As soon as we walked in, the cashier was not friendly at all and rushed us so much that she even over charged me! By the time I noticed it was too late. The restrooms are disgusting, you could tell they hadn't  been cleaned in a while or even on a regular basis. The waitress only came by to give us our drinks and then once again to let is know they were going to be closing. She never offered refills or to pick up our stacked plates and basically kicked us out. The food was an average C. Not only is this place overpriced for how crappy they are but they still managed to rip me off even more by double charging a tip on my bill on a party of 3 when they state they only charge tip on parties of 8 or more. Avoid all of this and go spend your money elsewhere.

Cold and gross is the best way to describe the food. This has to be one of the worst dining experiences I have had in my life in the last 30 years. Even worse was it cost of this horrible meal. Read the reviews that's where we made our mistake. We forgot to read them before we went in the restaurant but now looking at them afterward we are in a hundred percent agreement with all of the one star reviews. This place was the absolute pits. Best way to describe the whole experience is cold gross food full of grease salt and MSG. Go to McDonald's you'll have a much better experience and a much better price.
Food was very tasty, liked the variety.  Place has some unusual odors and not too clean.  Workers not too friendly. Separate charge for drinks.  Thought it was strange for a buffet.

There are several Buffet@Asia in town, but this one is definitely the best. Lunch (less than $8, drink included) is your above average Chinese fare, but they change up the menu, so you will see different dishes on a regular basis. I awarded the 4 stars because of their dinner buffet. Last time I ate here (Sat night), I was determined to load up on sushi, but they offered so many different seafood dishes that I had to pass. For sure quality food at a very affordable price. Find a solution for your dirty trays of dishes and maintain your crowded bathroom better and I will award the 5th star!
I want to use a credit card payment, but they want to charge me $1 service charge.The lunch person is $8.49 see on the poster .but they $13 to charge me ? I don't know why? Poor service attitude??

It's been a long time since we ate there.  Some of the food was ok but when I saw a roach cross the floor and go under our table, I totally freaked out and never went back.   That might have been a one-time thing but I just can't bring myself to return.

restaurant owner has some serious racial discrimination problems. for you all that does not care about discrimination, go ahead continue dining there.  p.s. food quality is.questionable. too bad there is not an one star option, or i would be glad to choose that.

We decided to check out this Buffet at Asia in Henderson, NV when we first visited to Nevada . DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME HERE. Upon entering this place not much of the staff spoke english, but they know how to count your money perfectly. There isn't much to write about the decor it's more like junior high cafeteria style wooden tables and small hard uncomfortable wooden chairs. There's a mediocre sushi bar near the front entrance.

The asian style ribs were so over cooked we couldn't eat them. We asked the waitress not to bring our drinks until we had gotten our food. I think the walls pay more attention to what you say then these people. Upon our return to the table there sat our drinks. Of course I requested she make all fresh drinks and watched her pour fresh drinks as well. I am very skeptical about unattended drinks and foods myself. Of course she wasn't very happy with my request and watching her back either. If you love seafood as I do such as fresh unlimited king crabs legs, fried blue claw crabs and fish etc. Now as of 2013 to present. Go to the Buffet @ Asia on Flamingo and Eastern Ave, Las Vegas. My nail technician recommended that place and we love it. 

The service is very friendly and the foods are always fresh and hot. There's a very high turn over during dinner hours from 4 pm to 9 pm. The lunch doesn't offer the same menu as the dinner does no king crab legs, fried frog legs, fried crab or pepper shrimp. The price for dinner is $13.95 you leave a tip after you dine. Alcohol drinks are extra but there's unlimited teas and water and Chi tea too. The dessert doesn't offer real ice cream it's just a frozen like iced milk. But they do have a selection of asian desserts cakes and cookies etc. The ribs are tasty but over cooked and dry. The veggies and rice are very good. King crab legs are a good size and plenty of them. But you must watch when they put them out because people grab them two plates full at a time. The atomosphere is relaxed and family friendly. They also have a huge wok station where you can choose your own ingredients too.

By far this is the best one of many of the Bufet @ asia to eat in Vegas. Be sure to dine no later than 8:30 pm because they will begin to clean the buffet to close for the night.

After writing my last review I realized that I had never reviewed Asia Buffet.

I have always gotten good service at this location- they have great food for a reasonable price. I find that I love their sushi especially the california roll and ebi.

They also serve good marinated steak. 

Yep I will go back!

This buffet has all the kinds of food you'd expect from a basic Asian buffet. It was good, satisfies you from dear hunger, although it wasn't as delicious as you would think it would be. The egg drop wonton soup was pretty bland. There wasn't a variety of deserts that I personally thought were good. The sushi was alright, I wasn't overly thrilled at the taste. Overall, it was an ohkay experience. However the staff were pretty friendly, our waitress that handled our drinks kept checking up on us and offered frequently to refill our drinks and clear our table from the used dishes. I would come back here, but won't be expecting much from it in the future.

As I've gone to buffet of asia through out the years Ive seen the quality of the food sink to the lowest low. The food is either dried out or  bad. I was there a long time & they never changed  the beef and brocolli, &  what was there should have been disposed of when I first got there. My mother asked for napkins. The waitress ignored her. The ice cream machine was filthy. They had no soup bowls for the soup. They had signs threatening to charge for food left on your plate. Waitresses only approach you to ask you to pay more money if sitting there & lunch tur0H lns to dinner.  They need to be kidding to expect a tip. Maybe hire a waitress thats happy to seen you there. They have no competition. Don't understand how they pass health inspections.

I hate uppity, fancy-pants, stuck up hipster yuppie duechey restaurants. In fact I absolutely despise them. All I care about is good food and service devoid of snobbery. Buffet @ Asia delivers on both counts. The floor staff was attentive and efficient, and friendly (and I am as white as whitey can be, so anyone who assumes that they will receive bad service from the 100% Asian staff does so in ignorance). 
Sure the place seems a tad run down at first glance, but this is not the case with the food. The selection is enormous, and omg it made me so happy! Everything I tried was absolutely delicious, with only one exception. Just skip the ribs. If you see ribs and think "Mmmmm.... Ribs." Just keep walking. They almost made me choke, and then almost made me puke.
This place, although in kind of a weird part of town, is an excellent choice if you love Asian food. It is NOT fancy! But it is awesome :)
P.S. The best part is that you wont be hungry 10 minutes later, mostly because you will still be stuffing it in your face! ;)
Thank you.
- Ken

Just went there with my girlfriend.  We went to the one on Rainbow Rd, we were originally going to visit the Pacific buffet, but we always see this place crowded so we figured why not.  I don't usuaully eat at buffets unless I know they are good, well this place blows Pacific out the door.  Their varieties were huge and the quality was excellent for the money.  Large variety of sushio, along with a well kept mongolian bbq, and I must recomen the steamed clams.  Between the clams, oysters, crab legs and craw fish, I honestly have no idea how this place makes money when considering the good quality along with the reasonable price.  This place has excellent service and unlike other buffets they actually make sure plenty of food is out at all times.  I was extremely impressed with this place, and the bar prices seem to be very reasonable.  As far as buffets go, this wins it hands down and then some.  There is no reason to try any other after this place, you will just be disappointed.  I highly recomend!

I dont understand why some of the reviewed are so low..I live in the neighbourhood for five years. This Asia buffet is our favorite still..And now it looks like under  new management and better than before..I give it 4 stars..And they're trying very hard to satisfy the customers.
Horrible experieces when having lunch in this restaurant! Wish i could give a negative star! Terrible customer service and show no respect to customers! DON'T TRY IT!

The most awful experience it was at this so called buffet where we ended up eating nothin but stale food for dinner that was all cooked for lunch. The ambience was totally disgusting and disordered. The waiters neither respond properly nor recognize the food being served. All together I would advice not to shell out even a penny for this food.
Very wide selection, including sushi.  Attentive staff.  Worth a do-over.

STAY AWAY! The owners are extremely rude, the service is horrible, and the food is not only unpalatable but is also dirty. It seems like the food has been sitting out here for ages. Came here with a tour bus and glad to never have to come back again.

I've been here twice and you really get a lot of value for $13 dinner. One of the reasons why I come here is because of the oysters and their seafood selection. Oysters are really big and they don't fuss when you ask them to put out some more even when they're about to close (I'm annoying when it comes to oysters,lol). They serve crab legs and Manila clams. They also have a really good desert selection. I love the sesame balls.

I came with an Asian tour bus group and they had more than enough seating for 30 plus of us.  $12 for lunch buffet with very sparse selection.  I didn't try the Mongolian stir-fry.  Food was mediocre and I think they only served different variations of california roll.  

Verdict - I was mildly satisfied and didn't get a stomachache, so I guess that's a win.

Giving it a 1 star due to being really dirty and not enough variety of desserts or food and bad customer service. 
I would never go back here again. 
Our waiter had a bad attitude and the restaurant  overall was dirty
One word.  "DISGUSTING".   Filthy,  food poisoning waiting to happen.  Food was old and cold.

This buffet has been on a steady decline over the last 5 years.  My first visit was October of 2005 and I thought it was amazing.  The selection was broad and the price was outrageously low.

I was introduced to this place by my cousin, who's a local, and I've been coming back ever since.  I haven't been back since March 2010.  I didn't write a review about this place then because I thought it was an off night.  It was primarily Chinese food and sushi rolls.  The dining areas looked run down and the rest room was a death trap.

Fast forward to August 2011.

Prices are still low but food quality has seriously declined.  It's strictly Chinese food now.  What throws it off is that there's a little side bar with banchan sides.  But what good is banchan if you can't pair it with Korean barbecue?

Dessert items are par for the course.  The sushi is ok, lots of fried rolls drenched with sweet sauces, and a few traditional varieties.  

The dining areas are still very much rundown and the restrooms are still death traps.  But drinks were refilled right away and plates were cleared in a heartbeat.  

Par for the course...
Ehhh if you want to come experience the worst customer service come here!!! Self serve, self drink but you have to go to the counter to ask for it, self clean your table. Cheap everything basically.

This place is filthy dirty!!!!!!!!! 
The food is ok nothing to want to come back to.
They really need to clean this place up. Looks like they never clean
Not bad for a buffet.  About $8/person for lunch.  Decent variety.
The only things that were good are the walnut shrimp and the fried rice. Everything else was bleh...

Let me begin by saying that if you are low on cash and want to eat at an Asian buffet this is the place to go. My wife and I went here due to indecisiveness and lazy to drive else where. 

Moreover the staff is quite friendly and pretty quick at serving the beverages. However the food...how can I say this...the food was sooo bland no taste. And for some reason right when I get my food and then sit down the food is already cold. Luckily we got there at dinner where they gave us more options. For example crabs legs, but even though the taste of the crab legs something was off. The butter for the crab legs taste like if it was old butter just being reused. 

I hate to give them such of a low rating but the fact that i couldn't eat another plate because of the taste and that my wife and I felt sick mildly sick afterwards. So like I said if your low on cash and want a buffet I would recommend but if you don't have a strong stomach and have taste preferences don't.

Went to this place before I flew out. It wasn't priced bad at 15.99 for friday dinner. They had steam crab legs, lobster pieces and various sushi. I was scared to go here based on some rating but it wasn't bad at all. I'm from my and the weekend buffet price is usually 20plus. The service is good but the woman who collects the money can sometimes come off as pushy. They had Tom yung soup which was a nice surprise. Don't expect the world but know you'll find something you'll like.

I don't know why this location has the lowest rating. I think the staff at this spot is by far the friendliest out of all the locations I've been to. We come here on the weekend for lunch pretty much every week. There aren't necessarily a ton of options, but it's good food, cooked fresh, and cheap for the whole family to eat. Pair that with the friendly service and it's always been a good experience! The bathrooms could be cleaner, but that's literally my only gripe with this spot. You can now get made-to-order Mongolian BBQ plates with your meal also.

Haven't written a review in awhile so I'll start 2016 fr3sh with buffet asia!! I'm on that clean eating so gotta get that grilled steak and chicken. Started with a salad you know.  Healthy shit. White rice for that clean carb action. The staff didn't really speak English but we're of much help. They're water refilling service was on point tonight. A+. What else could you eat for 13 bucks for this fantastic bargain. Shit if I went to bwws I would of spent the same thing.. with alcohol tho. I'd be drunk. Anyways I approve of this establishment. Good job south side buffet asia. 5 stars for the water refillment not even Jupiter himself could accomplish

I friends took us to their favorite buffet last weekend.  I love this place!   Tasty food with a lot of choices!  Very reasonable prices for lobster buffet during weekend dinners!  Highly recomended!!!

We were here with the tour group. 

The service: They will pick up cash from table to table. If you swipe the card? they will charge you extra. 

I don't eat buffet too much and I don't  like buffet at all, but this is the worst buffet  that I ever had. 

Everything on the sushi counter taste the same: Kewpie mayonnaise.
Customized fresh wok vegetables, meat and noodle smells great, but it tasted bland. 
Fried snacks are tasteless and soggy. Fried cheese wrap is disgusting. There is no taste, no flavor and the cheese filling is dry.
The rest dishes on the counter is over salted. Everything taste the same, it was all cooked with soy sauce. 
Steamed bun/steam cake is edible. 
Desserts cake is classic and it's okay.
Green jelly is gross. It was sour and bitter, I have no idea what that is and what that suppose to be. 
Totally inedible. 

This place is even worse than Panda express. 
If I had the choice on that day? I will never walk into that place.

Not the best chinese buffet that I've been to but not the worst either. The fried rice, cream cheese wontons, and chicken skewers are pretty good. I didn't try the sushi or mongolian bbq section. $14 for dinner...seemed a little high for the quality. I prob won't go back.

To me Buffet@Asia is quite good in every aspects.

1.food selections: Excellent 
Not only Chinese dishes are served in this restaurant but they also offer Thai,Japanese,Korean as well as  Mongolian BBQ,seafood,salad bar,fruit and ice-cream.

2.Taste of food: Good

3.Service: excellent service 
The staffs are attentive and move in a fast pace.They remove plates  very quick unlike other buffet that let your plates stack up.

4.Cleanliness: Good
The staffs clean the floor regularly.

5.Price: Excellent
It is quite cheap and you get a bit more than you pay.Less than $10 dollars for lunch and $less than$21 dollars for AYCE seafood dinner.can't beat that.


Good for big party,family as well as
 kids friendly

This place kicks butt.  The only negative is that if I eat here more often, I would be a big tub of goo... 

Best days are to go on Fridays and Saturday ~ seafood night.  Come early; otherwise, there may be a wait and the food may not be as fresh as late in the night.

Usually, I focused on the crab legs and the oysters.  When it is oysters season, this places rocks!  It has the freshest oysters that we have ever had in Vegas.  By the way, we ate at the Southpointe casino the other day and their oysters like yuck....

As for the crab legs, large and juicy.  Yummy!

Atmosphere -- it is a buffet folks
Service -- seems alot of young chinese people ~ probably students.  They do work hard.  
Price -- it is about $20.. much better and more affordable than the strip at $35-40 bucks per head... 

I love this place.  If I could eat here everyday, it would be awesome... My cholesterol and weight would go through the roof.  

Definitely, one of the best in Vegas.

Freshest food I have EVER seen on a chinese buffet!  I have eaten at a few different chinese buffets, including the Buffet Asia on the other side of town. I was a little taken aback today when we were charged $8.99 apiece (plus tax), but to be honest, it was worth every penny. Everything was not only fresh and beautiful, but each and every item had a sticker above it with the time that it had been brought out! Wow! Impressive!

The sushi was beautiful, there were plenty of delicious choices, and there was an abundance of ginger and wasabi. The fresh fruit was just that - fresh, and many choices. I personally LOVE the mongolian grill, and this one is my favorite because they used paper thin slices of meat-chicken, pork and beef, and all of the sides I love: water chestnuts, sprouts, cabbage, broccoli, garlic, baby corn, celery, etc. Mmmm, super good. 

I'm just very impressed. The place was clean, the food not only looked good, but was delicious. Sometimes at a chinese buffet, I take little bits, because I either don't know what it is, or I want to try it to see if it tastes good. Not necessary here. Everything I took was delicious! Oh, and the service was also very attentive. 

In reference to Meg H. on Aug 16, we had iced tea, and the girl refilled it every few minutes, however, if you order thai tea, there is an extra charge for that.

My mother, who eats like a bird, had just had outpatient surgery and we went straight to eat afterwards. She ate like a logger! I don't think I've ever seen her eat so much! Go mom! 

Can't wait to go back!

Pretty good food for a buffet.  I'm not too much into buffets but since I was in Vegas and you can't leave Vegas without a buffet...This one was a great one to go too especially if you're tired of the Vegas Steak prime rib specials.

The seafood was fresh, the food was always served hot, and the wait staff was pretty prompt about making sure the tables were clean, plates were taken soon after finishing a mean, and the drinks were always refilled.  

My sister actually had her wedding reception here and they did a good job accomodating us, EXCEPT, when the wanted to seat other guests in the area my sister reserved.  That I felt was kind of rude...

A Buffet is a buffet so I don't know what else to say bout it, but HMMMMM deliciouso....
The food is terrible and the service is very bad. Never eat here. We went to eat there, but the waitress is so mean. And the food is not good and old food. The receptionist is impolite.

This location was the cleanest and best but after eating here last Wednesday it was horrible. The service was the same as usual which is really bad and the tables were filthy. The tables and seats had oil all over from previous customers eating and wiping their hands on the seat. You would think that they'd clean the tables and seats after a customer leaves. The whole place is just nasty. Then the people that change the food out don't even wear gloves. When they change out the trays they put the left overs on top of the new without gloves. Don't waste your money especially your time!

came here cause i seen they had sapporos and sushi. but when i i got there they hadn't been serving sapporos for a week,the sushi looked old, and sadly they didn't have oysters either. not that i would have ate them after seeing the condition the sushi was in but over all i was disappointed in this place. thought some ice cream would help but two of the 3 options were unavailable :( *tear

If you're looking for authentic Asian food, sorry this isn't the place. Definitely Americanized everything here. Pretty much an AYCE Panda Express minus the awesome taste. Went in for lunch and the selection was pretty limited. 
You get what you pay for. The one thing I'm glad they didn't mess up were the fried donuts. Literally filled up on desserts....
The service isn't there and shouldn't expect much, I mean it's a buffet :) 
Don't think I'm curious enough to try lunch. Would rather spend that money for a single meal.
They probably have the best seafood selection (for what you pay for) out of all the chinese buffets in the valley. The only bad thing is it's really warm/hot in there almost like the AC isn't on.

I went in with my expectations appropriately lowered after reading all the reviews, and you know what?  I wasn't disappointed.

First off, this is a great deal for lunch.  $9 + tip and that includes a drink.  I went in around 3:15 and stayed for the shiftover to "dinner" at 3:45 and it was exactly the same thing, with the added benefit of a steak (and something else) cooked to order.  I found that they had a fair range of items; all the staples of fast food Chinese--orange chicken, honey chicken, teriyaki chicken, spare ribs, Mongolian BBQ...plus more.  I wasn't too happy with the actual taste of the choices, but for $9 it can't be beat.  

I probably won't be returning, but I don't regret trying it out.  I guess I'd prefer a classic "around the world" buffet that includes Asian specialties among others.

Came here for lunch with a friend who eats here often (my first time). This is an inexpensive Asian buffet. There must have been 30 different choices including a variety of sushi, beef ribs, mussels, a couple of shrimp options, orange chicken, teriyaki chicken, noodle dishes, wan tons, fresh cut fruit, almond cookies, fried donuts, and soft serve "ice cream." were any of the dishes gourmet quality. Nope. But this is a $9 buffet for lunch. If your expectation is an upscale sit down restaurant, you are going to be disappointed. But if you compare this meal to an under $10 fast food meal, definitely 4 star. Also more generous with the rating because the staff was very pleasant and friendly. Would come back when looking for an unrushed, inexpensive fast food meal.

This used to be a decent buffet but not anymore. The cashier had an unpleasant attitude, as well as the guy who was cooking the Mongolian BBQ. There was a bell to ring when ready to order & I rung the bell  & still he took his sweet time. I asked the cashier if he could hear the bell & instead of her going to get him she told me that I just have to wait. The food was not that good in selection or flavor. The crab legs were dry, tasteless & overcooked. I went to bathroom to wash my hands & the cashier came out of the stall & walked out of restroom without washing hers. I told my server that I hope she doesn't touch any food because she just left the bathroom without washing her hands. My server just smiled & said nothing. After seeing that I was done with this place. Never again will I be back.
The food has been sitting there for a couple hours and the restrooms are disgusting I don't think they putting them in a couple of days

It has been a while since my last visit to buffet asia.  The food was reasonably good but the facility itself was horribly dirty.  I am surprised i did not get sick.  For starters, i watched them wash the floor with dishrags then put them on the beverage service bar, then move them onto a chair then the same rag was used to clean a table top.  YIKES!  At the mongolian section, while the cook was cooking my food, out came one of those rags and he was cleaning the grill and the rag touched my food!!!  YIKES.  The walls around the edge of our booth was covered with splatter and a quick look around, splatter and finger prints and dust and just plain dirty.  Like I said, the food was good and i made it through the night, but when you really look around at this place, you would think the health department would shut them down.  I could site many more observations, but i think you get it.  I also think many of the staff are living there.  I got a look in the back of house and i really think they are living in the kitchen.  I dont think I will every return.  Also, very unfriendly staff, maybe they just dont speak English??  Dunno.

I'm actually impressed with how bad this place is. I was warned not to come here and still did.. can not believe they are still in business. This is worst food I've ever eaten. Flavorless junk. I think I might actually get sick just from how the food looks in the bar. Tried several different things, small portions, it's all horrible.

My nephew is 2 years old and he is 3 feet 5 inches tall so the cashier insisted that he has to be charged half of the adult's price.  I found this to be ridiculous because no 2 year old child eats half of what an adult eats!  But their rule is, if you are over 3', you are charged half the adult's price.  The only thing my nephew ate was an ice cream cone!

Everything that I tried was very salty!!  And this is the first buffet that I have been to where they do not give free refill on drinks.  If you're going to do that, at least not make your food so damn salty.  Jeebus!  

On top of poo poo food, their service is beyond terrible!  Usually if a place has bad service, the food compensates for it or vice versa but good lord this place lacks both.  I will never ever eat here again.

There's a lot of food, nothing that was too good.  My boyfriend loves it because he eats so much but not much variety in sushi.  Quality was just not that great. Place is not that clean either, there was a bug that crawled on the wall at our table!  My first and last time there.

I'm not huge on buffets... but this particular buffet was ok.  

the spread is a little bit of all the choice asian cuisines.  mostly chinese and japanese.  they also offer a dessert/ and fruits section.. as well as a soup section. the sushi was pretty fresh considering its a buffet

servers are there to serve.. 
not to show their friendly.. so, in this setting it works for me.  

it's busy because pricing is fair  and its located on eastern.. a very busy street.  anyway... not the first place on my list.. or the 10th either.

Went here with a friend for dinner on 12/2/14 and the food itself was very good.  What irked me is the restaurant itself.  The booth seats were not fastened to the floor so when myself or the person behind me got up the whole seat moved.  Also there was dirty dishes on carts just piled up not to far from the food.  And the restrooms..the smell was so bad and unkept that it smelled worse than a rest area.

Will I go back to this one..no.  I do like the one on Rainbow/Sahara.

This will be the last time i will eat in this place.we had lunch buffet today and the ambiance that you can smell in the dining area is the dirty restroom that never been cleaned and the lady that was inspecting the food and looking at the customers eating around was more concern how much and what kind of food youre getting that making the place clean and better ambiance for customers while dining.i feel i wanna throw up with the food i ingested with the bad air from the rest room i wonder how this place pass the inspection by the dept of health. Its terrible and never be the place to eat and dine.we paid lunch buffet because when we get there its a late lunch and at 3:45 pm they started to serve dinner my husband triednto get lobster and part of the dinner menu becuse they serve it for dinner the server approach him that he is not allowed to get dinner food unless he has to pay $5'more because thats a dinner. Food this is the only place ive known would embarass customer not to eat food they serve it should be specific in their rules when the customer pay so we know but ive know some buffet places that doesnt care what you eat as long as you pay and that skinny asia lady that watches the customer the amount of food. Customer are getting is like an idiot and she should check their restroom instead rather than watching customer while their eating. Very dirty and bad palce to eat with idiot server

I felt like I was transported to China. The hygiene & service standard of this restaurant is certainly unexpected of an F & B place in the United States. I was even taken aback by the taste & preparation of Chinese food which was so different from what I've had in Singapore & the U. S. It was bland, salty, & unappetizingly unfresh & poorly presented. We were neither served water nor the drinks we ordered within 15 minutes of our arrival. I had to ask 3 times & walked up to the waitress to remind her. Terrible place to eat at. Won't come back.

The staff and food are not good, save your money!
Tables seemed dirty and staff unmotivated. The food is not hot and very limited in choices.
We will not be coming back to this restaurant..

This is definitely one of the better Asian buffets in town! We've tried all the buffet @ asias and this is our favorite. What really makes it stand out though, is they have a girl working here I feel like she goes by Cindy. She's SUPER friendly, attentive, and has even offered to have food made for us that wasn't out on that particular day. We've been here a few times and she's always awesome and definitely deserves the recognition! She's not even a server as far as I know. She's usually up at the front.

I also like this buffet because they offer a little more variety, like they have awesome tempura and Thai soups. The food is always hot and fresh. Definitely the best choice if you're looking for an Asian buffet.
Nothing seemed fresh. All the seafood was completely over cooked. Place over all seems dirty.

Where else can you go for a buffet that tastes better than Todai and pay half the price?  Well, go to Buffet @ Asia.  I found out about this place when we were at a friend's house in Henderson.  

I feel their selection is just as good, if not better than most buffets.  They have a good selection of food.  Sushi, crab legs, sauteed lobster, mongolian bbq, an assortment of foods from different areas of Asia, and a good dessert bar with a chocolate fountain.  Whenever we go there, we spend hours getting fat.  If you go with me, maybe you can watch the "Bottomless Pit Experience" where my friend eats as many plates as he can.  Trust me, you'll love it here.

This is one of our favorite buffets to go to.  The food is always good, plentiful and varied.  The sushi is fresh and there is usually more than just basic California rolls like most other Asian buffets offer.  

The staff is always kind and attentive.  They clear plates quickly and my glass is never more than half empty, and I tend to go through tea pretty quickly. 

One last comment, my guy and I decided to start a new Christmas tradition this year since I wasn't feeling well enough to cook a fancy dinner on Christmas eve.  I always thought it would be fun to go for Chinese,  a la The Christmas Story.  This buffet was the first place that popped into my head.  Thankfully they were open, although we arrived about 30 mins before they were set to close so we were prepared to have to stuff our faces pretty quickly.  So not the case!  There were quite a few tables of people still.  They were still bringing out fresh food (even up to the time we left, which was after closing time), the staff was still very attentive and never made us feel rushed.  We still weren't the last ones there when we left to a nice season's greeting from all the staff.  I think we have found our Christmas Eve tradition spot for the foreseeable future!!

I've dined at this buffet a couple times so far. First and foremost, usually when it comes to buffets, in general, don't expect anything extravagant. When you think about it, you're spending a set amount of money to have "unlimited" access to average food. 
With that being said, this buffet offers a decent selection of food, especially seafood items. I also like how they offer a good selection of fruits in the dessert area. Majority of the items I had here were pretty good. Also, each time I've been here, I've had good customer service.
I don't have any major complaints about this place. 3 out of 5 stars.

Yikes. It says a lot when you walk in to an empty dining room at dinner time. The price is $15 with a drink for AYCE buffet. The food is mostly mushy and old. Since there weren't many diners, they weren't really making anything fresh. I did have have some sushi, some of it looked questionable but the pieces I did try were okay. They do use imitation crab tho. Nothing is labeled so I have no idea what I am eating, which irks me. Cream cheese wontons were cold and had a smidgen of cream cheese in them. I had the hot and sour soup, which had a weird aftertaste. I love crab legs, which they only serve at dinner time, but these were so skinny and small, I could hardly get any meat out of them. I ended up giving up after I had a slimy, mushy mess on the plate in front of me. Our server was kind and attentive, and refilled our drinks frequently. I won't be back.

If you can ignore the mouse trap in the women's restroom, this place is pretty decent haha. My friends and I were on a Chinese bus tour and we stopped here before heading back to California. The lunch buffet was 12 bucks and food was tasty. My favorites were the eggplant tofu, bok choy, Jin dui sesame red bean ball and the wonton with cheese on it.

This was the nastiest restaurants I have ever been in. I can't for the life of me, figure out why the health department hasn't closed it down. 

My husband and I wanted Chinese food, saw this place and decided to try it. We were seated and then went up to the buffet and retrieved our plates. I noticed something felt greasy under my plate and turned it over. It was filthy, absolutely no exaggeration. I grabbed my husband and had him flip his plate over, again the same filth. I took the plates back to the pile we got them from and set them aside. Picked up another couple plates and turned them over, disgusting! I set those aside and started going through the pile. Every plate i picked up was greasy and had food residue on it.

At this time, I decided to talk to the people at the front counter. I showed them the plates and told them the whole stack was dirty. They told us to try another stack of plates so we did. The very same grease and crud was on those plates. In the meantime, the woman took the plates into what I assume was the kitchen. She emerged telling us it was taken care of. I told her I couldn't find any clean plates so she disappeared into the kitchen again. Out she comes with a stack of styrofoam plates, seriously. She put them by a stack of dishes and I grabbed a couple. 

We put a varied assortment of food on our styrofoam plates and headed back to our table. I started to eat only to find the food lukewarm. Got up, went and grabbed another plate and dished up some other items of food and returned to my seat. Oh swell the same lukewarm temperature.

In the meantime, I see a guy from the kitchen come out with stacks of plates on a cart. He stops at the first stack of plates and piles the fresh plates onto the dirty ones. Goes to another stack and does the same thing. Out of curiosity I go and get a fresh plate off the first pile he stacked. The plate was filthy! Picked up a few more and the same thing, grease and food residue. So, I decided to check the warmth of the food in all the tables by hovering my hand over the food to see if I could feel any heat. Barely felt anything. This was not near closing, this was at dinner time. I wanted to scream at the other people eating there to check the underside of their plates and ask if they noticed that their food was not hot as required by law, but I didn't.

So, the next time you go there, check every plate you use and don't eat food that is lukewarm as it could make you very sick or kill you!

By the way, Chinese are notoriously cheap. That would explain the dirty dishes, not using sufficiently hot water and changing the water in the rinse tank. As for the warmth of the food, it costs money to raise the temperature in the steam tables as it consumes more gas and that costs money. 

Diner Beware!

I've been to buffet Asia before, the one on rainbow, and it is my favorite. This one not so much. The staff is nice, but the food has no taste, not to mention the place itself. I've never seen a place so dirty before. Like I said I love buffet Asia, but the food in this one is not good at all.
Typical asian buffet. Nothing too special. Desserts aren't that good.

I like this place a lot. One of the better Asian buffet places I have been to. For 17 dollars,  I had sushi, sashimi, frozen yogurt, lobster, Chinese food, Asian soups, and a nice selection of cakes and cookies.  The quality of the food was really good.  I did not find any items that were bad. Everything was either good or OK.  The buffet tables were well maintained. If something ran out, they would replace it very fast.  I think this place is better than any buffet place I have been to in San Francisco.  I am impressed by this place. I would not mind going to this place again. Also, this  place has a Mongolian / Korean BBQ option that is included in the price.

If I could give this place zero stars I would! More then half of the "hot" items on the stream tables were luke warm to cold, including shellfish. The items needn't to be served cold looked to have been sitting there for a VERY long time. The bathroom was disguisting! The beige tile floors were mostly black, the counter was covered in water, there was hair in the sink, and the trash was overflowing. Don't even bother!

This used to be our favorite Asian buffet in town, not any more!  We were there last week and we can't believe we've been eating there as long as we have.  The place was absolutely filthy, don't even go in the men's room!  The ladies room isn't quite as bad.  The place is run down and looks like a soup kitchen.  There are beggars out front peddling garbage or begging for money.  Passing over most of the food which just looked like slop I settled on cold shrimp by the "salad" portion of the counters.  I was going to have a salad but the lettuce was wilted and didn't look good.  The sushi looked okay so I chose a CA roll then a bowl of wonton soup which was quite tasty.  I had a couple bites from my son's plate and wasn't impressed.  My brother ended up in the men's room tossing his cookies after taking a couple bites of something he had grilled.  I didn't personally see any CR's but I'm sure they are around.  The employees seemed like zombies.  It was just "all about collecting your money" to them.  We couldn't get refills or dirty plates cleared.  I tried to ask one employee a question about the ice cream machine and they looked past me and kept on going.  Tried to get a small cone and stood there for 3 minutes for one inch stream.  I think it was empty and nobody cared.  I tasted the chocolate that seemed to be coming out ok but OMG it was horrible.  If that was chocolate, I'm never eating it again.  Price at lunch is almost $10.00 and for dinner (after 3:30 pm) it is about $13.99.  Way over priced for such a dump with nasty food.  If you find yourself here, I recommend the fresh fruits.  I hope these are okay because I did enjoy those.

Absolutely the most disgusting place I have ever walked into. The entry way was filthy. The service upon arriving was horrible. The floor is covered in fifth, because apparently the staff does nothing here. The food is unmarked so we didn't know what anything was. I can't say much to the taste of anything because the appearance was enough for me. We asked for a refund and left immediately! I will not be returning to this place again.

This is probably the worst restaurant I've ever been. Food is okay, but the restroom is very disgusting. They are also using disposable tableware, which feels extremely cheap. At this price, you can definitely go to a better place.
its a ok place.. not too expensive but some of the dishes are quite good others are just ok. parking is horrible.
Variety was great and food was very fresh and flavorful. You definitely can't beat the price! I would definitely eat here again!

Popular buffet in the burbs focusing on various asian cuisines, including, Japanese, Thai, Korean and Chinese. The quality of the food is just OK, as you'd for these lower end buffets. This is certainly no Todai. The overall quality is influenced greatly by how long the food has been sitting under the heat lamps. The first plate of Pad Thai was pretty good, while a later plate was pretty lackluster.

While my dad loves the Korean beef that is cooked by a chef, I like the  garlic string beans best. There at least a half dozen different chicken dishes, in all different styles. I didn't care for the lemon chicken, while the others were decent.  My mom said the fish balls weren't too good. The sushi are unremarkable.

They have yellow watermelon which is good. I like the almond jello too. I'd avoid the perennial chocolate fountain.

Service is average. Sunset station is much better at picking up the finished plates promptly. Here they are about average.

$6.99 lunch includes hot tea, but not sodas. Good value. Get there early as there's a wait once you hit 12:30 or so.

Did Lady Luck rob you blind? Perhaps the dealer had gotten a 21 one time too many and now you're completely broke but still want to eat your sadness away? Well look no further than Buffet @ Asia. Who can drop that much money Bacchanal Buffet anyways? For as little as $15 (that said I didn't get too good of a look at the prices if you know what I mean), you can gorge yourself alongside others determined to commit gluttony. Score yourself a 15% coupon and you even get to save some more! Maybe that $30 that you saved can lead to a jackpot! Just be aware, this is a Chinese buffet, as in don't expect the best.

Like most Chinese buffets at dinner time, the place was loaded with seafood. Most importantly, they had dim sum style lobster! For $15, you're getting all you can eat lobster. Am I dreaming and living the buffet life or what? Throw in salmon sashimi, crab legs, frog legs, and dynamite and it's a home run! Unfortunately, I must admit that the food is obviously not of the best quality. The clams were sandy and had a weird, somewhat metallic taste. The oysters weren't very fresh and weren't cleaned properly. The nigiri had obviously been sitting out for a long time and should have been disposed of. At the beginning of service, the salmon sashimi was very very good. Then, it became horrible cuts and believe it or not, I found a piece of bone in a piece. Yuck! The shrimp dynamite was deliciously cheesy and creamy but none of the shrimp were deveined. I don't know about anything else I found that the taste of the food in general was strong; it's heavily seasoned. 

Now, onto service. Holy moly! My table literally never had an empty plate at any time. There were times they carted my plate away while I still had food on it that I was getting to! And yes, most of the time, the item about to be taken away were lobsters and crab legs. My water was constantly being filled to the very blink. They were probably hoping that I'd get full off the water. 

Overall, for $15, this place is a steal. It's a bit messy but this is a Chinese buffet boy! You do't come here for world class service; you come here for food at dirt cheap prices.

Trust these reviews omg when I was a yung weedhead this was my go to munchie place about 7-8 years ago...I went there today and literally finished half a plate...disgusting,bland,greasy,and looking at the dirt dust food compacted on the walls right next to me just did it for me omg this place has lost it. I tried to be discrete in the pictures I took so I hope u can see this dirt is about a foot away from us and my plate which I couldn't even finish I know it was only $26 for us but it was definitely wasted. I give two stars for my unseeet tea,they were nice,and we got right in and honestly,I feel bad because this has been a Henderson staple for years WHAT HAPPENED

The food taste is ok, im come here in lunch time . I give one star is about the service kind of rude and they using disposable plates ,forks and spoon also cup too . I know the price is very cheap in this area (Las Vegas) just $13 including tips but i don't know the real price must be more cheap. I come with tour
Food is really good and fresh and sushis are amazing! Love the ambiance as well. One thing though, their servers need to smile more. Because that's how you get good tips is by your customer service.

One star doesn't do justice for this grimy place! My boyfriend and I decided to try it out since we haven't been in many many years...Well, what a horrible mistake!! As soon as we entered the so called restaurant that smells like wet dog the lady at the front was immediately distasteful and pushy. Once seated, we waited awhile for someone to greet us and take our drink order so we could get food. Finally some guy casually walks out from the kitchen and greets us! 
We get up and start with the Sushi Bar...Just by looking at it you could already taste the stale, dried out rolls! There was sticky notes that said "For Dinner Only" on some roles! Assuming they were left out since lunch time! Gross AF! 

We both got a couple that looked decent and kept going down the line thinking it would get better... Salad bar next.... WHAT salad bar?!?! There were two shrubs of lettuce and that was it. I didn't even bother.... Soups looked nasty and probably hadn't been changed since December of last year! 
 I don't know how anyone could consume this food!


We finally sit down and pick at the few things on our plates... my boyfriends eyes grew huge when chewing on the orange chicken, he said  tasted like rubber! We both tried a sushi roll and nearly spit it out, edamame was frozen, noodles were stale, long story short everything was garbage!! ( After we left we felt sick to our stomachs with the little amount we ate )

We have never been the kind of rude people to make a scene and walk out...So we politely told our waiter we were going to leave and my boyfriend was generous enough to pay for one meal! They were so rude when we were leaving and obviously talking shit in Chinese! They didn't deserve any money ! 

 I'm sure we are not the only ones who have been so disgusted and left!! Please don't give this restaurant your business! It needs to be shut down!

This is another highly requested place when friends or family come to visit. Cheap, good for large groups, and always good  service. Come here on an empty stomach because there's a lot of food there's Mongolian, crab legs, oyster, a pretty good sushi selections, sashimi, tempura veggies, and the regular Chinese buffet food, for under $20. They also make steaks made to order, frog legs, Thai tea.  There's not a lot of selection for desserts but who's there for that. There's a lot of space but always gets busy so don't mine if you might have to wait a bit, or just call in advance especially with larger groups.

well... you can never be satisfied after you leave a buffet but over all buffet asia is really worth it. def go there for dinners because its only 4 bucks extra but you get so much more stuff such as 2 types of crab legs, better shrimps and oysters, steaks , sushi and sashimi and much more. i would never go there again for lunch....never again. its also a place you can go alone and you wouldnt feel weird.

This place is a little different from the one on Sahara & Rainbow (I'm a regular there, it's closer to my house), but still just as good. They have edamame in the salad section and a really really (really!!) spicy thai soup. I dare you to eat a whole bowl. This restaurant has a much nicer ambience and I'd go more often if it wasn't so far away. Service is always nice.

During numerous trips to Vegas, I've frequented the Buffet at Asia on Rainbow Blvd. (My review of that place here: (http://www.yelp.com/biz/buffet-at-asia-las-vegas-4#hrid:mSPf88mhq76t49Qo-3jtlw). In the sea of Vegas buffets, Buffet at Asia is one of the best ones in my opinion for Asian food. On my latest Vegas trip however, I got to try for the first time to the Buffet at Asia in the Henderson area.

The setup of this Buffet at Asia is a little bit different from the one on the westside. This one has one long row of food items that starts with a Mongolian wok type cookery. Next up is their sushi items and then this is followed by the soups: wonton, miso and seafood soup. Up next is the traditional Asian buffet food: they have good offerings like egg rolls, egg foo young, orange chicken, chicken skewers, dumplings and veggie tempura. Off to the side is their desserts: some items are orange jello, almond jello, chocolate mousse, frozen yogurt and sesame balls. I like how above the food items are big, bright lights and letters showing the name of the different areas. So very Vegas picturesque ;)

They do offer some food that the Buffet at Asia on Rainbow doesn't have. It was the first time I saw these chicken with cheese wontons that I really liked. I did think however that the selection over at the Buffet at Asia on Rainbow is larger. This branch at Henderson had good food offerings but not as many as the westside location. Nevertheless, the food here is a good and if in you are in Henderson, it's a good place to go to. It's less than $10 and includes a drink!

I go with friends often for their oyster, sushi and crab but this place getting worse, crab really salty lately, when those trays are empty they take time to refill them and when you take oysters they watching you with sad angry face and make comments in Chinese ...
I am not going back there and i don't recommend this place
This buffet has gone up in price and down in quality. The food was horrible and there was barely anything to choose from. The place is dirty and we even found a hair in the food.

This is the most uncomfortable and not convenient Asian buffet restaurant to eat first of all the ambiance is hot and the customer service was not good enough second the restrooms are so unpleasant smell and the beverages area is dirty...... this is not recommended to eat.

DO NOT COME HERE! I don't know what sucks more: their non existent service or their food. 

The food:

Let's start off with the best thing there: honeydew. I should have just ate honeydew the whole time because everything else sucked. Don't even bother getting their sushi....it's just California roll with sauce on top or presented differently. Their seafood soup or whatever tasted very fishy. The pineapples looked like they had been sitting out for too long. Idk the food was just a huge mess.
