I felt like I only ate their veggie tempura, baked sweet potato and honey dew the whole time because everything else sucked. And as for the veggie tempura, it wasn't even good, but it was one of the better food options. Thank god they didn't fail on baking the sweet potato or else idk how and why they are still open. 

The service:


We asked for napkins like literally 5 times and the waitresses had attitude. We also asked for hot tea and they put the hot tea in a plastic cup. Wait hold up? Have these waitresses not gone thru some type of food handlers training? Even if they didn't, do they not have common sense? Because you know it's common sense to not put hot drinks in plastic cups. Omg. They need to throw these waitresses back into kindergarten cus clearly they hired dumbasses. They also don't know how to own a business because the customer should always be right. We asked for the hot tea to be poured into a mug, but the waitress said the mug is for coffee only. Like wtf?! Are you stupid? Sigh.

Went here with a friend from Europe who insisted on going to a cheap Vegas buffet.  I didn't want to go but I humored him.  The place is filthy and the buffet doesn't look much better.  

I suspect this place probably wouldn't pass a proper health inspection.
waaaahhhh...pls dont!!!try krazy buffet...good service, clean place, nice food!!!

We were pretty hungry from hanging out at the pool all day so we were starved.  We arrived at 3:00 so we still paid the lunch price, which was @$8.  The price was really good because it includes drinks also.
There were sushi, Mongolian bbq, soups, chinese dishes, salted prawns, fresh fruits and salads.  Yum, must try if you're in the area.

Payed when entering and was seated very quickly. They asked us what we wanted to drink and we were off to get food.

Still has the best asian food around the Vegas area. Good prices compared to the buffets at the casinos and the food is really fresh and flavorful. They have a lot of vegetable options, seafood options and meat options. They have a wide range of sushi options and even serve sashimi. The fish is very fresh. Mongolian bbq prepared in front of you, and you get to choose what you want in it. They even have short ribs, which is a first ive ever seen for Mongolian bbq. 

I noticed as i was leaving however, that they seated the Asians away from the Non-Asians. haha that was funny.

This is definitely a place of extremes.  Floor is dirty, tables are not adequately cleaned and the tables are four inches from each other in many places.  The food is quite good which for a buffet is well above average.  The variety is not as good as it used to be.  Fewer Chinese dishes and more meat (chicken, fish, beef or pork) dishes without vegetables.  The Mongolian BBQ in which you choose your ingredients and they cook that for you is still the best deal in the house.  The crab legs, shrimp, octopus, clams and mussels were all good as long as you don't mind having your shrimp and octopus breaded and fried.  Sushi was slightly above average for a buffet and won't compete with any sushi restaurant this side of your local grocery store.  I like the place for what it is, a lot of good food at a reasonable price.  Wait service is poor but I suspect most tips are too.
Very tasty, kinds of Asian food. U won't regret to be here. Our family like it very much. Many people came here to eat. The boss always takes care of his clients. The service is very nice.

This place doesn't even deserve one star!  It is absolutely disgusting!  Myself and my guest both got food poisoning from this place!  We went there on April 25, 2013.  Our sickness lasted for days!  Everything on the buffet was old, dried out and room temperature.  And omg....the bathrooms....wow!!!!  Absolutely disgusting!  The entire place was filthy.  I knew we should have walked out immediately!  Just from the smell inside the place.  Whatever you do.....remember....you are taking a very very big chance if you eat here!  I think it would be more likely than not....that you will end up sick!  We actually got staph food poisoning from here.  Otherwise known as "Staphylococcus aureus bacterium".  I truly believe this place needs to be SHUT DOWN PERMANENTLY!!!

Not sure why this place gets knocked a lot but I do enjoy the occasional Asian buffet splurge and I think this particular location provides a good bang for your buck.  I probably come here twice a year and I have yet to be disappointed.

The price for dinner is about 1/3 that of a Strip buffet's price with a plethora of options to choose from for food and dessert.  Along with your freshly cooked typical Chinese fare, other options include a variety of soups, a sushi bar, a Mongolian BBQ/noodle station, and American classics (pizza for instance).  

What makes this establishment even more worthwhile is their crab claws.  Now if you're a fan of the buttery crustaceans then definitely go here one time!   The last time I had dinner here, the claws were replaced frequently and the size of the claws rival those of their Strip buffet counterparts.  An unlimited amount of crab legs is probably bad for the heart but good for the soul.  :)

This location hosts a private room for private parties if needed and the space is pretty clean and well-maintained overall.  However, the bathrooms could definitely use a make-over.   

When you're trying to stuff yourself and your family without breaking the bank, consider a trip to this buffet.  Your appetite will thank you for it.

Yelp 100 Challenge 2016 - 18 / 100

The food here was decent but not labeled at all or inaccurate. The floors were dirty and so greasy in one area of the buffet that it was slippery. It was too expensive and also we got charged separately for fountain drinks. The servers were very friendly...
Dirty restaurant and way below average food. How's it passing health inspection...food doesn't appear fresh at all : (

There are only a few things at this place that is fresh, first the price, $12.99 for dinner. The alaska crab legs, and mongolian grill. Everything
else is in between rotted and getting there. If you get an ammonia taste when eating seafood, its because its rotted. Thats the breakdown of the protein. I can't understand why people keep eating rotted foods???
Do you like your sushi with brown edges???
So pick your food carefully at this buffet place.

This place is disgusting! Why it hasn't been closed down by the Health Department I don't know. The entire building is filthy dirty. The bathrooms are probably the most disgusting but the rest of the place isn't far behind. Bathrooms are used for storage & it looks as if they have never, ever been cleaned. One of the serving tables has a drain that opens into an open drain right in the aisle where customers walk. The food that is put out on the tables is pretty bad too. The sushi is old & dried out. The Mongolian grill wasn't even operating, and the items that were being brought out were overcooked & tasteless.This used to be a decent place to go when it first opened, but now it's a real shithole! No stars for this place, 5 stars if they shut it down!

In this review I am going to get right to the point.  Food was not very good at all; with a few exceptions. Restaurant was really warm and absolutely FILTHY!!

The staff was extremely friendly and you knew they appreciated the business.

If they could just really, really clean the restaurant it would go a long way.

As Visitors to the USA we stayed in Nellis found this place by accident on our second night and read some reviews quickly before going in and where a bit concerned. It was almost closing time but the negative reviews seem unfair, the food was great and to get this array of dishes else where in the world prices are up over at least double. We decided to try early the following night and where suitably impressed again in particular the seafood. For around ten bucks a head better option than some greasy burger, fried chicken or pizza

This used to be one of my favorite places to eat. Not any more. Food was mediocre. Bathrooms were nasty. Waitress didn't want to wait on us. Not once did she come to our table to ask how we were doing or refill our drinks. We stopped her to get refills she acted like it was the end of the world. Very rude. Her tip reflected her service. Notta!!! Will I go back? No.

If the food was as nice as our server, this place would get 5 stars but unfortunately it wasn't. The sushi felt like plastic and the rice was hard, the Chinese food was room temperature, nothing was hot or cold. The soft serve ice cream and the almond cookie was the best of this meal.

I was impressed with how fresh the food look when I first came in! 
When I come to asian buffet, I usually look for crab legs and sushi. And this place has it all!! 
They didn't went cheap on making sushi, although the rice was not soft and chewy enough. 
They got battered fried crab legs and the steam crab legs, which are both very good to me. Other seafood include crawfishes and shrimps and fried frog legs.

Where to begin?!? There is sooo much to say about Buffet Asia!!! The outward appearance looks very inviting, so driving by my husband and I decided to give it a try.... we should have kept driving!! If there was a negative 1, I would give it a negative ten! We walk in and have to wait to be seated because the receptionist is busy yelling at her two kids!?! We are seated at a dirty booth with crab shells in the seat and gnats in the window! Tthe food servers act like you bother them by asking a simple question...my waitress was more like the "napkin bandit" who acted like the napkins were hostages! Ask for one and you got attitude and given one at a time! The food is gross with very little flavor and all has a similar after taste like it was cooked in the same pots and pans, seats are dirty covered in food and grease, the dispensers of sauce on the table look like they haven't been wiped off in months, flies swarm the food in the buffet area, filthy bathroom with roach spray boxes of RODENT POISON!!! Really!!! My sake was served in a dirty decanter! Eat there at your own risk!! My husband and I both had the runs after eating a small portion of food.
Where is a health inspector when you need one?!?

The food is pretty good with a decent selection but the environment could use some work. You smell like the food when you leave this place. Ventilation is poor and during the summer it gets extremely warm. Because of the steam from the buffet to keep the food hot, it can get humid in there.

Best Chinese buffet in Las Vegas and not expensive.  I've been coming here for years and the place is always packed and their quality is consistently good.   For 10 dollars you get better selection than some of the buffets on the strip that charge 20-30 dollars.   Restaurant is well kept and clean but not fancy
Some food has no flavor at all and their sushi rice is hard. Went home with a stomache...

Oh man. This place was bad. As soon as we sat down, I noticed how sticky the table was. C'mon! The food was not good. Not even the ice cream cones were good. I can't even think of one item here that was...food. Avoid the seafood at all costs... Yes, avoid the seafood at an Asian buffet. It was all 'meh' at best. I just can't get over how bad this food was...it's making me mad just thinking about the $35 I wasted on this place. The only time I've left an AYCE still HUNGRY. On the way home, I told my husband that I was glad we have multiple bathrooms in our house, because we'll be needing them. He's currently in the bathroom... Again. We almost forgot to write this review, but my husband's diarrhea reminded us. Before you leave, make sure to grab your soggy fortune cookie!!

This was definitely an impulse decision for me and my husband because we were so hungry. We decided to give it a try and disregard the bad reviews. It's a mediocre buffet and it's exactly what you expect from a Chinese buffet. You get what you pay for, so I can't really complain that the food was ookay. They had crab legs since it was dinner time and that made up for the other bland choices. The butter tasted like movie popcorn butter and it made me feel weird. They also had raw oysters which were decent, but I prayed before I ate them just in case I would get sick afterwards. Crab rangoons had little to no filling. Everything else from the fried rice, beef with broccoli, wonton soup, etc was bland and so-so. 
On the plus side, the staff was super friendly and nice. They refilled our drinks and took old plates away quickly.



Case in point- it's a cheap Chinese buffet.

This place made me sick. Lady was rude at the door at 1st. Then the food was disgusting. Dirty eaten off of plates all over the place on carts. Then the lady came with the check and handed me a pen and said "sign this" I said right now as I'm putting food into my mouth? This place is horrible.
It's pretty much a dump. I came here with a tour. Food is gross, service is terrible, and bathrooms are filthy!

Never never again will I go there very limited food bland and siting was crazy rude waiter's I can't believe the service there and after words my stomach hurted so bad it's not funny I would not ever go back
A moderately good buffet. A variety of Chinese foods, Sushi and desserts. The food quality isn't great, but it's edible.

We have been there for lunch which was just ok, decided to go for dinner....what a waste!  Main food was over cooked like it was left over from lunch and it was 6:30 when we got there.  Ordered Korean short ribs from the grill and I said that I wanted it for 2 people.  Paper thin and they cut it up and gave us 2 small pieces.  Needless to say I'm going home hungry!  Never again!
Was brought here by tourist bus. Food is mediocre and the place is not well maintained. Their rest room is horrible. You have better choice nearby Vegas, go somewhere else.

It is ok for Asian food but I have had much better and to tell the truth the food kinda tastes a bit stale if that is possible.  I have eaten here 3 times and each time I was hoping for better like some of my old haunts back east.  This location is better than the one in Henderson on Eastern ave.  Lunch time is crowded and you will likely wait for a seat.

Now this is a regular place for my family to stop at when we are in vegas. It is definitely not as fancy or as good as the regular buffets on the strip but I will tell you this. For its price it is a good lunch alternative. We have never had anyone get sick and everyone always finds something to eat. 

For 13 bucks you get exactly what you pay for and similar places in socal offer basically the exact same stuff. However, if you go to some random buffet on the strip you will end up paying 30 to 50 a person and about half the time you will be disappointed. So save yourself the hassle on of those mornings and get a lunch here.

Majority of the seafood and sushi was not fresh. Very dirty, the waitress began setting the table despite previously spilled sugar and food crumbs. I had to ask them to clean it. The floor was wet and very dirty where they sat us and they ignored it until we complained but all they did was put napkins on the floor. One of the drinks was forgotten to be served until we were about halfway done with our meal.

Came here during Halloween night. The restaurant was 1/4 occupied. 

This branch is cleaner and more spacious compared to the Rainbow/Sahara branch. 

Food? That's questionable. I understand that it's cheap but the quality of food that you get is the same thing... The only one good dish here is the cubed beef with gravy. The rest is blah!
Lots of items to choose from and friendly service.  Very reasonable price for a Vegas buffett......Highly recommended.

my wife and i have eaten at this place before...we went back today for lunch at 1:30 pm.. the food was disgusting...horrible......all the beef dishes were very tough, could hardly chew it. i think this place either changed hands,,, new owners....or the current owner doesn't care what kind of food he serves his customers... we would never go back there again.....time to find a new place.....danny and jo

$10 all you can eat Asian food with a drink. There is a Mongolian grill where u can create your own entree. If that sucks its your fault. Haha. The other food ranges from good to mediocre. Just depends on your taste I guess. It's a great lunch spot for me n my coworkers. It's nothing close to gourmet but it will get you full and leave you satisfied. I've never left disappointed. Asian food with a drink for $10 u can't go wrong. Just don't expect too much.

Great place for lunch during the week. Large selection to choose from and always clean. Just want to avoid stopping in when the Asian tour buses arrive. It can get crowded pretty quick. During this time they put out Styrofoam plates since most of the tourist are getting their lunch to go. Overall I think this is one of the better Asian buffets.
Decent food at a great price. Unfortunately, the place is so jam packed it's almost an inconvenience to head back to the buffet lines.
Good chinese buffet... It was the best chinese buffet I had been too... They also have crabs, oysters and variety of chinese food to choose from...

I go here at least once a month with a group of girls for our Chinese fix. We always have a good time and the food is amazing. One of the things we like is the fact that there is a huge amount of guests that are Asian and that is always a sign that the food tastes good or is close to authentic. I am truly happy with the offerings and they are vast. Very delicious and continuosly fresh no matter what time of day.

This place has it all. Food is delicious and their selection is well catered to. 

Cost wise it is sufficient if u especially like seafood. 
The Restraunt has different ethic dishes in the asajn cuisine. So when in Vegas, get off the strip and try something in the surrounding areas.

I don't know why I expected this to be good & no offense fellow yelpers, but yuck!

Maybe we went on an off night, but the food was cold, boring & bland.
I should know better than to go to a buffet.  I never find them satisfying.

It made me & my husband feel a bit queasy all evening.

I've been to this buffet a few times and it does not disappoint. The food is great and they have a lot of choices not like other buffets out there. I especially enjoyed their fried sushi which was really yummy. They also have a mongolian grill where you can choose whatever you want for them to cook

The price is not so bad either, you get good food for a great price!

Stopped here for their lunch buffet on a cross-country roadtrip.

Lunch for us was 11 dollars per person which covered drinks+tip

Typical asian buffet with eggrolls, dumplings, orange chicken, etc. They have a good selection of foods, with a sushi section(a bit bland) and a made to order Mongolian BBQ section that's covered in your buffet. I didn't notice til the end. However,  desert is lacking with few fruits and ice cream. The food was decent tasting compared to other asian buffets I've been to and the fact that I haven't had stomach problems the whole day means it's on par with ingredidents! 

Service there was very sullen, as if workers really disliked being there. Basically, overall gloomy ambiance from them. However, did enjoy the neon signs over the food sections, very Vegas-esque. :]

I was short on time and only had an hour to eat. But for the price vs quality, I think it's a good run for your money if you're looking for an asian buffet in Vegas. Just don't expect superior quality service!
In 3 words.....Horrible, Horrible, Horrible. Price has gone up and quality has gone down. This used to be a GREAT buffet, now it sucks bad. Will never go here again.

Look at the picture of the steak and lamb chops that they show in the picture and compare it to what you get, digusting! 
They charge a little more because there is LOBSTER on the menu on the weekends, how special! NOOOOO it's so grossly prepared with gluey sauce and the huge lobster claws have no meat inside. Oh look some crab legs, that should be good, right? Nooooo it's dry and the most low grade crab I have ever tasted! Again a huge pile of raw salmon on a plate is "sashimi"? how do they get away with this? Look at the wasabi is all gone, but do they change it out for fresh? nope, the "sushi chef" doesn't care. Believe me go to Panda Express, go home and watch TV.

Muy rica comida.
Buena atención
Lugar limpio.
Uno de mis lugares favoritos para salir a comer. Se los recomiendo.
Felicitaciones escelente lugar.

This is one of the worst place to come with your family , you can't understand there English well and the manager mistreats the people and I really don't recommend this place It was the worst experience I've ever received

Usually I leave a buffet with a major stomach ache.....Not this time. The food was good plus they had Kal-bi and crab legs. Service wasn't to friendly but that's usually the trend at an asian restaurant. I'd go back though.
I don't recommend this one, bad servise, the waitress very mean here, very bad .the food soso

Only came here because our tour bus stopped here. Nothing interesting about food, they did not serve drinks unless we went up to the waitress and asked them for some. 
I understand that it's a cheap Chinese buffet, but they went to another level when they made us use styrofoam plates and cups and plastic utensils. What kind of restaurant does that?
Terrible service. Went in night before last and now my girlfriend is puking.. My advise go anywhere else. There dirty and the bathrooms are disgusting. OVERALL HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!

2.5/5

The food here was simply OK. The sushi was anything-but-fresh bordering on questionable. Their chopped up lobster chunks were plentiful and decent. The hot shrimp was probably my favorite thing. The spicy chicken was actually spicy. The beef was terrible as expected at a seafood place. The soft serve dessert was too icy. 

No one got sick and the service was good for what was.
great food ?waitrees are friendly and lovely?price was fine too ?we will be back soon

the first time we came here, it was a saturday for lunch and we thought "wow! how cheap for such delicious food!". so we went back, but this time on sunday....ok.....the sunday price not so great. sunday price is the same as dinner price all day. but hey, it was still worth it since we got to fight over lobster with all the greedy-4 hour-buffet-eating locals. LOL the food is terrific, i can't complain about it. when we go visit our friend in henderson, we like to eat here. fresh seafood, crab legs, sushi is pretty good, lobsters and many of the typical chinese dishes. all drinks (not alcohol) is included too so i think my table had a good round of thai ice tea. i'm not sure why but their buffet stations have glass enclosures on the side by the clean dishes.... me and two of my friends hit our hands on the glass trying to grab a dish (3 separate times)...lolol guess we're just not use to the enclosure.

Buffet@Asia is a greasy great for a hang over meal buffet.  They have all the american Chinese dishes that many like to eat.  Nothing too special here.  Very average seating area, the food can be a mix of pretty warm to very lukewarm.  The price is good but the food is sub par to meh.  If you really just need some oily stick to your gut super sweet and fried chinese food for pretty cheap, eat here.  If you want some good chinese food head down the street to east ocean.  But for what it is, and you like cheap asian buffets it fits the bill.

If there was a way I could put a -10 as a rating I would. Just finished eating dinner with my mom and she ended up with explosive diarrhea in their bathroom. Food was not as fresh as it seems to be. Now my mom looks like a character from The Walking Dead. 
I would stay away from this place for a while. Or until the health inspectors come by and see their dinner menu.
The food was ok, a lot of greasy food. Under our table was very dirty. Food and napkins stuck to table and floor. Overall cleanliness, poor.

Paid $13.99 not including a drink per person, the only reason the price was high (I think) is because they serve crab legs and sushi.  Otherwise this buffet should be more like $6.99/person and if it was I still will not go back.  Sushi was brown like it had been sitting, crab legs were skinny but okay- the butter for the crab looked and tasted like cooking oil.  Several dishes had no serving utensil,  empty food trays were never refilled and the "salad" was a few pieces of browned lettuce floating in a watery pool.  The meat dishes were tough as if reheated,  soda tasted watered down and the restaurant smelled like bathroom cleaner.  I was actually worried I may get sick from the little bit of food I did try.  The servers were nice but I will not be going back.

AYCE lunch under $9 that offers every stereotypical Asian food known to white man. Here is a place you will find the strange ppl that live in Vegas. Just another surreal sight to see while trying to get thru your hangover from going to TAO and XS last night you know who you are!

Bonus: Mongolian BBQ grill and free Thai Iced Tea.

Great food for the price and real great if you are pressed for time. Depending on which location you are at, they also serve Korean BBQ at some of their spots, and that would have to be my favorite at this place.

Althought the food isn't authentic, you will definitely find a dish you can dig into for the time you are there. I prefer the lunch time just because you really get so much food for your money.

Server kept on missing us even though we were stationed in the pathway to the employee section and they charge you got drinks.  Which isn't bad in the beginning but if you wanna switch drinks such as ice tea to a sprite, they charge you for the soda change. 
Understandable if it was can soda but it's a
Fountain machine.  Fountain machines are inexpensive. 
Changed. Changed for the bad from what I've seen. 
The Mexican workers on lunch break were being messy when they ate there lunch such as using utensils for one item for all to grab. Young fellow.

I've come here a couple times for the lunch buffet, it was very filling, but after a while I wish there were more choices. I like that in the front of the restaurant, you can make a plate of raw food and have the chef cook it for you. There are an assortment of meats, veggies, and noodles for you to combine and have them stir-fry with soysauce. *don't forget to tip :)

The Asian selection is nice, there's the sushi bar, fruits/desserts, soups, appetizers, noodles/rice, meats, and veggies. Of course the food tastes best when its fresh and hot, so you just have to time it right when they re-fill the section. 

The place usually has a good amount of people, but we never have to wait for seating. The staff is attentive, they always know when we are done eating, and bring us fortune cookies.

I was debating a while whether this was 1 or 2 stars :/

So tour buses apparently love stopping here. I get that. It's cheap, it's chinese. But there were 4 different tour buses that stopped here the day that we went. And for some odd reason, this place just was not ready. The tour we were on had been doing this same trip once a week for some time as well and had stopped here previously. So it's not like they didn't know a whole bunch of people were about to come in.

And yet, they still weren't ready. We paid our dues and were given a paper w/ a receipt, and someone took us to a table. Since they did not have enough tables for everyone, some families were combined. In the table we were at, with seating for 4, with 5 people sitting in it, there was a box on one of the seats, so only 3 people could actually "sit" at that table. After saying good bye to the box, we went to get the food.

Except there wasn't any. I think after my first go, I got a few noodles, some broccoli beef, some veggies, 2 pieces of sushi, and that was about it. I think everything else was just empty. 

They also have fruit and apple pie that's not too sweet.

The mushroom with cheese in the middle was one of the better choices that they had, but it took me 3 walkthroughs to get there. It took them til almost the end (45 mins after we had arrived) to fill the sushi section. They had two sections, one of which was completely empty for the longest time. Smh. They have some soups which I didn't try and the rest are chinese foods :P

Plates are either plates that have some dirty stuff on it or plastic plates. utensils are also all plastic. Soda is DIY in the fountain in the back. And it's also kinda dirty :/

If I had gotten a chance to eaten some of the food, maybe a 2 star review? But since I had a very limited meal of almost nothing, I can only rate it on what I had.

Most pictures included with my review were taken after I finished eating...

Buffet @ Asia? Buffet @ China more likely.  

Not a bad place if you like inexpensive Chinese food. 

The servers are not friendly but they're quick, helpful and very attentive.  The pay-for-lunch-stay-for-dinner trick doesn't work here.

This is probably the only location I like out of all the Buffet at Asia restaurants in town.  The food isn't soggy like the other locations.  Lots of variety.  It's above average especially for the price.  I actually don't enjoy the asian buffet places, but I can come back to this one.

Worse place I ever ate!  Came here with my wife and son,  going down the line looking at all the mis-labeled dishes, the sauteed mushrooms labeled as chicken wings lol. So I reluctantly start putting things on my plate, sat down and took a bite of the mayonnaise shrimp, was like eating cream of wheat... mushy. Bit into the Hawaiian short ribs, it was like drinking a 1/4 cup of oil! I instantly grew a pimple. The steamed rice was like it was never cooked... hard like rocks.  And out desperation trying to find SOMETHING that was worth swallowing, I tried this mystery meat because there was no label, it looked like chicken to me... but it wasn't. My wife and son just "forced" themselves to eat because she would've felt bad for walking out. At least my son ate enough ice cream to get his money's worth lol. I had them take my price of the bill... will never return
I love this little place.  Good food, decent sushi, friendly service, and tasty thai tea.  Prices are good, and there's never a wait.
I love Asian food, but this buffet is yuck, staff not very friendly, food not always fresh, small n crowded eating area

I think the food is just "ok" but the one thing I hate is poor customer service. From the moment me and my family walked in it was terrible! We were a party of 2 small children (3 yrs old) and 4 adults. When the cashier was ringing us up she tried to charge me for 6 adults and I politely reminded her we had 2 kids, she scoffed and told me next time I needed to be ready and have the kids line up next to some height measuring line on the wall. We were then escorted to our table. Our waitress took our drink order, I asked for juice for the little boys and her reply was " we dont have no juice". When I asked what drinks they had the waitress said she would just bring them Orange soda. (Whatever, at this point we all just wanted to eat) Overall it was just a mediocre experience. OH I ALMOST FORGOT!!..... When the waitress brought us a refill on our drinks she brought them back in the same glasses that she put her fingers in while carrying them back to get refilled! GROSS!!! The glasses were greasy too! When we asked for new glasses she rolled her eyes and told one of the bussers to get us new drinks.. The dining area wasnt too clean so that says a lot to me about how clean their kitchen may be... I probably wont EVER go back there. SORRY BUFFET @Asia... Work on your customer service and the cleanliness of your restaurant!

Crappy customer service stay away!!!!
These people are d o rude and try in any way to make an extra buck! You can barely understand what they are saying and are fast to shut you up! The waiter rushes you! Food is okay but the staff really make this place suck!

Well look at me ma!  Cranking out reviews like there is no tomorrow!  Aren't you guys proud of me?

For this review I will be writing about Buffet @ Asia...  I bet you were wondering why I would come here when I'm in Vegas?

1)  I'm the buffet king remember?  It's my duty to check out the land of the buffets and give them a piece of my mind!

2)  We were no where near the strip

3)  They said that they offered Lobsters!!  (For dinner only!)

4)  It's only $8.99 for Lunch!!!  (This price for a buffet in Vegas is awesome!)

So.....  What's good here!

Food!  Many of the hot items were tasty... Sushi wasn't so exciting, but they do have oxtail soup that was super delicious!  Light tasty broth accompanied by meaty oxtails!  Oh boy oh boy!!!

Prices!  Well... if you don't feel like spending $20+ for a strip buffet, here is a delicious alternate!

As for the lobsters.. I missed out... came here for lunch so didn't get a chance to eat lobsters...

So what are the downsides to this place?

- Sort of hard to find... tucked inside a business plaza but hidden away from everything and placed in the corner...
- Parking is semi limited.... only about 10-15 spaces out front... otherwise you have to walk...
- Decor is very run-down... some torn chairs are very visible.... doesn't put out a good vibe because it seems though that they don't really care about looking pretty for the customers...


Would I go here?  Yes.... for the food, price it's a total yes... but definitely not for the drive or the decor as they both are disappointing...  (the drive would be real far for those staying on the strip...)

But should you ever be in the Henderson area and is literally dying of hunger, I think this place can help!

The best buffet I have ever had in my life and it's $14 and it's fresh great service and its family owned and it's always busy so tough to even get a seat I love this place and their soda is tasty and not over the top bubbly go here not the hotels for buffets

This on the list of the worst restaurants I have ever been to.  From the outside it looks nice.. that's about it.  The place was dirty and if you have to use the restroom, you are better off squatting in the desert with the chance of getting bitten by a snake it was so dirty.  All of the food was tasteless and we barely ate anything.  Never again, avoid this place like the plague!!

This is the worst I had ever eaten restaurant. Service is the worst restaurant. If you use credit card more than $1. And tell us it's bank to collect the money. This is we in to help him pay tax. Joke

DONT GO THIS BUFFET
Everything was gross af and nothing to eat
Dirty and employees were rude
Im not gonna come here anymore
They also overcharged me and my friend and I couldn't eat anything.

My mother came in and they had things sitting from last night and she asked if when they will have calamari out. The cashier started raising her voice and shouting at my mom. She was not friendly and another person came to her defense and told her off. Never coming back again!

This is the WORST buffet I've ever been too.
The food was not diversity, cost you 1$ more to get your food into the grill, extra cost for slushies.
The food was lack of season, the deserst was too few and too sweet.
The employee was not friendly at all. they move the trash can around the table to collect dirty dish.
1 star is because I cannot give it 0 star.
Such a waste of time comming here, you should never ever come here.
12$ + 1$ of the grilled food. Not worth it.

As with any buffet, you get what you pay for.  This place is about $14 for dinner if I recall correctly.

The Mongolian grill section doesn't have much selection to choose from, but it's pretty yummy regardless.  The sushi is surprisingly good for buffet sushi.  Pot stickers are really good.  Pepper steak is excellent.  Orange chicken is decent.

So why only 2 stars?  Well, it's the tour groups.  The place is a madhouse when the tour groups come in.  It's just too crowded to find any sort of comfort.  Not to mention the people on the tour group are frequently rude and shove you and cut in line.  They used to only have tour groups on weekend nights.  They are there all the time now, even weekday lunches.  Not to be racist, but there is a cultural difference that I just can't wrap my head around.  I don't understand visiting a foreign country and eating a bastardized version of food from your homeland.

Good selection and kept fresh. Staff not always as courteous or as helpful.
Price and quality make this a regular for me.
DO NOT GO HERE! Came here for lunch and I had to get my money back immediately. The food looked and smelled old. Please do yourself a favor and go else where.

The very first time I ate here, I was blown away.  It was cheap, and I could eat all the seafood and kalbi I wanted.  But over the recent years, there buffet has begun to decrease in quality and quantity.  

Now, there is no selection for seafood.  I haven't gone here for dinner, but before for lunch they'd have lobster or crab legs set out with the kalbi.  I think they might've taken it away from the lunch menu and added it to dinner, or they might've taken it away.  I might just have to experience dinner here one day.  

The location on Eastern used to be a little more cleaner than all their other locations, but so far not so much.  They have dishes laid out everywhere, and sometimes their table smells like wet towels.  Try avoid eating the noodles, or rice...it looks like it's been sitting out for a while and it did give me a sore stomach.

What a bargain!!! The price is low already, and if you look out for coupons in the mail: Katy bar the door! I think I ate half my body weight in pepper shrimp. I went for lunch and from what I heard this is nothing compared to the dinner, I shall have to return and find out for myself, I may, however need someone to roll me out when all is said and done, or in this case eaten. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

This place isn't great. I won't be back. Some of the food was okay but overall just not worth the price. It's also a strange set up. They have you pay at the end and drinks are not included in buffet price. So depending on when you go you could end up paying nearly $20 a person for mediocre at best food. Besides the green beans. Those were good but still not $20 good.

You get what you paid for. The food is so so, the drinks is so so, and the service is well.... So so. They advertise "lobster" as if their buffet is filled with it. But honest to god. You are lucky if you can land a lousy lobster tail. It's greasy, small, messy, and the portion is horrible. You would think that because they advertise it so much the serving tray would at least be big. Nope.  So if you are looking for a cheap buffet that fills your hunger then ya definitely a go. 
Overall :
Pros: 
1. cheap cheap cheap buffet $14.08 (tax included) 
2. Not really a long wait line to get in
3. So so food, service, drinks

Cons;
1. Lobster advertisement is a scam
2. Food tastes w/e
Came for dinner for $14.99 theres alot of selections including crab legs, soft shell crab, fresh made sushi.
This is a cheap place. They treat bus tourists as refugees. We use foam plates, take own drinks, dispose out own trash, no credit cards, some more expensive food was empty no refills.

Food was cold & Greasy
This location is not Good 
I've been to the location on Sahara & Rainbow much much better
I was even charged a different price then listed price also different price then Rainbow

This place is so dirty and the people are so rude. They fought with us because they thought we didn't pay a drink when we clearly had the receipt on hand.

Take your $10 somewhere else or across the street to Chick-fil-a 

Never coming back here again

I did not like eating here! Food was below-average quality. Sushi had no flavor - the only thing you can taste is the mayo sauce they squeeze all over ALL of the rolls. The Mongolian BBQ has no flavor (there's no sauces for you to choose like at a real MBBQ joint), lots of fried food (cheap), what fresh fish they did have (shrimp) I just didn't trust. Service makes you feel like you're an imposition. Signs all over the walls about the ramifications if you waste food. Jeeze. Never going here again. A friend talked me into going... next time I PICK THE RESTAURANT.

My mom treated us for my daughter's birthday here since it wasn't too far from my brother's home.  This was probably my least favorite of the Chinese buffets my mom has taken us to the past couple years.

The service was not too bad, but the selection wasn't as good as it could be and the foot just not as tasty.  Some foods seemed to have been sitting there for awhile, therefore, things that should be soft were hard.

It just wasn't as tasty as Krazy Buffet or the ones in the Phx area that we like.  The place had a nice ambiance, though, the tables were a bit high for those people who are shorter.

The taste just didn't make this place appealing to me to go back.  Thankful to my mom who treated us.  It was $13.95 per person for dinner and that included a non-alcoholic drink.

First the Customer service was ok. However, the food did not sit well with my stomach, so if you have a weak stomach be careful. Second, I noticed a sign that says if you don't eat all your food you will be charged (which means two things). One, usually when a sign says that it's because the food is not great so many people leave left over food on their plates (if the food was great, everyone would eat almost everything). Second when a restaurant especially a buffet is cheap on the food, then they are cheap with the quality. Thirdly, the bathrooms were nasty and graffiti writing all over the walls (this place was not in a good neighborhood). I recommend eating on the Strip or a casino.
I love the food here, customer service is exceptional on a given day, location is perfect.  Downside is that lack of parking space when this place is busy which is common, and no takeouts.
Horrible! Worst buffet ever! Way overpriced for the terrible food they serve! Yuck! I obviously would never recommend this place.

No stars!!!! DIRTY, FILTHY AND THE FOOD WASNT KEPT WARM OR COOL.....entrance is dirty, door is dirty. I don't know how they're still open or not on Dirty Diner!! Horrible!!!! I only gave them ONE star because I had to before posting this!

What a dump. Cold food. Empty restaurant so the food just got colder. The crusty men's room looks like something in Afghanistan. Graffiti and rusty walls. If you do go, make sure you're there when a tour bus is there so the food gets cycled faster. Some of the food tastes ok and I don't feel sick hours later so that's good. That's not enough to make this place worth going to in a town with fabulous restaurants. 

Lowe's is right next door. Buy a couple of cans of paint for crying out loud

Wow was this place awful! Came here one time before and it was alright then but this time not so good. Everything seemed like it was made hours before we got there. The sweet n sour sauce had a funny taste and so did the egg rolls and most of the fried foods. All the sushi was the same exact thing with different sauce or vegi on the outside. So no variety there. The restaurant was very dirty. The salt pepper and soy sauce bottles on the table felt and looked like they were never wiped down. The floors were nasty and dusty.  2 hours later and I have this nasty after taste in my mouth from the food. I am staying away from Chinese buffets from now on!

The food was 2/5, the customer service was a 2/5 as well. I stayed away from the sushi, the cooked seafood and just had some of the meats. I believe this is the worst one of the 3 BA's I have been too. 

- Meat - 2/5
- Seafood - Did not touch it...
Sushi - Did not touch it... It looked a little fishy!
- Veggies - 2/5
- Fruits - 1/5
- Sides - 2/5 (rice, noodles, etc) 
- Price - 2/5 should be less
- Customer Service - 2/5

$8.99 for lunch? You really do get what you pay for. The food is very...acceptable. Typical chinese buffet food, nothing to really rave about. The staff was unfriendly and the place was pretty crowded. Decor reminded me of an old diner. Bottom line, if you're looking for a cheap meal with average food, Buffet @ Asia is the place to go.

Wow! Don't know that this place would pass a health code inspection!? We approached the front door and found it to be so dirty itself that I was afraid to grab the handle and not come away with a sticky hand. The grease trail and spat out gum all over the front of the restaurant was not a nice welcome. We entered the place to see patrons who looked like they were trapped in an eternal fog. One look at the "sushi" if you could call it that and I looked at my wife and said "nope"! We turn around and reluctantly touch that door again. We then proceeded to the really nice Italian restaurant in the next parking lot over. FYI I've eaten in some pretty sketchy places, super dive taco shops are a favorite of mine but this place?! I just couldn't bring myself to gamble on it.
This place has gone downhill so much in the last year. This will be my last time here.  This place is FILTHY. Grossly filthy. Every inch of it.

My first impression of walking in. filthy, dirty napkins swept to the middle of the restaurant next to the employee podium. So we looked at the food and almost walked out but we were hungry so we decided to stay.   
Food was greasy, cheap and all around not good. Service was very slow on a night that wasn't even busy. 
They don't fill the food fast enough, took 20 minutes for an item to come out. 
I don't like writing bad reviews but this place is horrible. 
Won't be back. 
-10 if it was possible.

Great food, especially for the price! A lot of filling cooked foods though so you end up getting full quickly. The sushi is not that good, but I can't really complain. They have delicious seaweed salad and I could go there just for that. Always the same food, but it's tasty.

I have been to several Buffet Asia's and all have been pretty nasty.. so I decided to give it one more try and go to the one close to my house, big mistake. Witnessed a server drop a fortune cookie on the floor and place it back on the check presenter on the table next to mine.. that was just the start of our dining experience. The waitress asked for our drink order and as we were giving it to her she was walked away saying, "ok,ok thank you".. all the tags on the line are incorrect and tons of cross contamination, not to mention they have raw oysters that are just sitting there and are at room temperature which is very dangerous!! They have store bought almond cookies and the salad bar has a big huge green light that says salads but all they have is cut romaine and that's it..  all the dipping sauces has a film on the meaning they are old and have been sitting there.. I could go on about all the health code violations they have here but it's way too much to list. All in all, if you're looking to get food poisoning then come to this place, you'll be sure to sick from something here!

When I first came here I was amazed by how much food they were serving. It is a usual buffet so you can go and pick out which food you want to eat. They have many different varieties to choose from and they are all in their own section. The place was nice, clean, and their food signs really catch your attention. If you're a person who is really hungry and is craving many different kinds of food then I would definitely suggest  this place for you. You can even bring your family if you wish as their buffet prices are very reasonable. I have been here 3 or 4 times already and I have not regretted one of them.
The food was decent but the customer service was two thumbs down. It took foreverrrr to get a refill on our drinks!!
Horrible it's smell horrible it was super dirty worse food experience ever
Large selection of dishes to choose from. The food doesn't really standout. It was average. Take only what you can eat.

My experience is slightly different than other reviews that I read. I have eaten at Chinese buffets all over the country and I find this one subpar even with the price acceptance. The hygiene standards are very off-putting. The dining room floor is obviously not cleaned on a daily basis and I'm curious if it's even cleaned on a weekly basis. The bathroom are disgusting. Even the door leading into the bathroom is covered in Grime. It looks like a door that I would see at an employee restroom at a garage or tire shop that is not used by the public. Inside the bathroom reeks of urine and has obviously not been fully cleaned in a very long time. It is a shame, because the bathroom itself would not take very much to get it up to standards. I found the food selection unusually Limited 4 a buffet. The one redeeming quality I found personally was the soups  I thought will well done. I will concede that soup is one of the hardest Foods to mess up. My experience with the wait staff was Pleasant, as they were friendly and kept my beverages topped off. Overall I was disappointed and in the end a little worried.  I have nothing against greasy spoons, but the hygiene standards I witnessed leave me wondering if I will spend this evening in the bathroom. I will not be returning.

This is an amazing place to go dine out with family. The workers there are amazing, they are quick to refill drinks when needed. The food is delicious and will have you coming for more! I highly recommend this place.

So some notes here. This location is much cleaner than the other one on Sahara.... price is less than the on on Sahara and also open 30 minutes later than Sahara location. All in all check this one out over Sahara location!

Pretty good eats if you want variety of food. Enough to get us full. 

The dessert here is lacking need something better for a buffet. Just a cone machine and a few odds and ends.. few like they could do better. 

The staff isn't to keen on making sure everything is perfect. We ran out of butter and they put a whole stick in the container and said we had to wait for it to melt. Well we tried to but it took forever.

Uhh, wow. 15 bucks for what is quite possibly the worst buffet I've ever had in my life. 

Smallest crab legs I've ever seen, all fried foods were over fried, too much oil used in chow mien and fried rice.  The only thing remotely edible was the Mongolian grill and even that was rather limited.  

Steer clear people, spend your hard earned money elsewhere.

One star minus one star = zero stars!! Please let me help you if you are thinking about eating here: DONT! I am an avid connesieur of buffets and this place is a hot mess!! I was put off immediately by the uncleanliness but we proceeded, watered down crab, amnesia salad made with mayonnaise, mushy food all around...don't eat here ever, waste of money! They have a sign that says they wool
Food was okay, but the employees were very rude. One employee yelled that she doesn't speak English at another person when she asked for something. Not a welcoming vibe.

I like this place. It is quite authentic and I know authentic, trust me.

Okay, they have some of the funky things fo the Western palate, but they have geat Clams, steamed fish, ox tail soup, and fried frog legs. You gotta be geat to have this stuff, and this place is one of my favorites to go to when I can't make it downtown.

Lots of Asians dine here, which means it is good.

Never been a fan at buffet Asia. The food is ok. The iced tea is what I call tea not so much ice and it is always hot in there (The one on Flamingo is even worse in my opinion). The few bright spots are that the drinks are included and the service is above average.

Totally worth it, I did dinner. salmon & tuna sashimi, many different sushi rolls, large oysters, fried shrimp, steak, white fish, beef & broccoli, chicken skewers, orange chicken, seasoned grilled shrimp, + tons more, was alot of great food to choose from & food was constantly filled up, all the food I tasted was delicious, 2 workers constantly creating sushi rolls, workers all over picking up plates & refilling food, waiter gave fast drink refills.  u can tell they're used to being packed - most tables were full. will definitely go there alot!!!!!   i asked what is difference between dinner and lunch and they said more seafood available during dinner.

To be fair, you can't go wrong here if you're looking for price... it's a $10 lunch buffet. 

Everything was pretty tasty but the food quality and upkeep of the facility fits the price... if that makes sense. Just one of those things you can tell if you work in the industry or you've eaten out at enough places or just have five working senses.

Also docked a star because my friend ordered a drink and never got it and I never got my coffee because apparently "coffee service ended" and it was 11 am. I'll keep my snarky comments to myself on that one.

Three and a half stars but rounded down for subpar service on this one.

I use to go here regularly, but my last visit will prevent any future consideration. Everything I liked about this place is nonexistent to include cleanlines, run down, greasy, overcooked, not fresh, over all poor, very poor. I have felt this way about this place for about a year now. The last straw is my wife and I throwing up everything we ate shortly after getting home. there are many points I could address about all the food on that buffet but, rather then be so insanely negative, I strongly suggest you protect your health and go else where. Makinos is 100x better in every way and then some. This place needs a serious reality check. I would be embarrassed to work there. I am hoping they lose enough business to shutdown and cleanup, get their act together and then reopen. Until then, they don't exist to me. I have been a loyal customer for far too long. Maybe the rainbow location is better, I will let you know. One star because a rating is required. Zero stars really should be an option.

How can you go wrong with a $13.00 dinner buffet?  This is not your super intense high end buffet and sometimes you just want to  stick with a place that works.  Sushi is pretty good and my son always goes for whatever is being made to order - in this case the mongolian barbecue got a workout. 

Lots of shrimp dishes, fresh shucked oysters, sashimi (mostly leftovers from the sushi), several soups and more.  The place is clean.  If you are out towards Henderson, this would be a good pick.

Unfortunate. I would recommend staying away from this place. The restaurant is not particularly clean, and the food is very sub par on many fronts; quality, taste and sitting time are a few points. Food from any mainstream fast good restaurant is about twice the quality.

Every time my family and I visit Vegas we somehow always end up here. Two things that are constantly good: Ox Tail Soup (only available at dinner) and sushi (really!). I also enjoy the fact that each diner gets to choose a steak or lamb chop made to order. They are not out-of-this-world steak and lamb chop but a buffet restaurant offering that is pretty awesome!

Been here only 3 times or so, i fell in love with the Lettuce Wrap. Gotta try those rice balls too, this place is incredibly unique compared to the strips' restaurants, buffets and California's Asian buffets. We need a branch in Southern Cali!
Food....not good...  place... so dirty!!! I will not come back unless Im desperate for a chinese buffet.

If you are craving Chinese buffet, this is not the place that I would recommend. Sure, there is a large variety of items to choose from.  However, the food is terrible.  Some of the items seemed to be on the inedible side.

I wouldn't have gone here for several reasons, if it were not because it is a mecca for tour bus and there were no other restaurants in the same shopping center.  1) The price for Sunday lunch was too expensive.  $14.99 for Sunday buffet?  That's outrageous.  2) The service.  They obviously could not handle a sudden rush of folks.  That's the unusual part as I am sure that tour buses stop here at least once a week. 3) I would have chosen to eat for the same or cheaper price at a off the strip buffet restaurant.  And 4) The A/C wasn't on.  With the weather outside in the 90's.  Are you crazy?

BTW, I ate at this restaurant two months ago.  The only reason that I still remember the dreadful experience is that it is in Las Vegas, one of the buffet meccas.

It's a good value for the price you pay for the quality of food, it's hard to beat dinner for $14 which includes a drink!  Clams, shrimp, tom yum, seafood mix, crab, crayfish, and sushi are included!  Keep in mind, the quality is only ok, not the best in how it was prepared but it's not bad either (too greasy for me).

Service is pretty good for a Chinese restaurant.  You will have to pay first before sitting down.
Many choices, lots of people. Sushi is fresh, they take there sweet time putting out crab legs
Super crummy buffet AND they charge leftover wasted food... If the food was actually good, maybe there wouldn't be any wasted food!

As soon as I walked in, I knew this had to be a really dirty place. And I was not wrong. I went to wash my hands only to find the DIRTIEST bathroom I've ever seen. I lost my appetite after that. Pretty sure there's a lot of health violations. 

If the bathroom was this dirty, I don't even want to imagine how dirty the kitchen is.

Food was ok. The ambiance was a bit dirty but hey, it's a chinese place; what' s new. I am so glad l didnt try ANY OF THE RAW meat kinda dish by the front door. There were FLIES HOVERING over it and possibly landed on it without anyone noticing it. Gross ! Should have snapped a pix of it. Know where flies' feet walk on ?
Obviously it's a buffet so they use very very low quality ingredients I can't imagine anything being worse than this in terms of Chinese food.
It smells pretty bad when you walk in. Food looks like it's been out for awhile. Cleanliness is a zero!

We've been coming here since the place opened. It's always been tasty and has plenty of options. But several months ago, management took away the Mongolian barbecue section. We haven't been back since. They need to quit bending over backwards for bus tours and serve what locals want. And we want Mongolian barbecue, not a third selection table of sushi. Two tables of sushi are quite enough.

This place is not for people who is looking for authentic Chinese food. If you are looking for quantity, this is the place to go. If you are looking for quality dinning, you may be disappointed. I came over with a Chinese tour and wish I had saved the money and went to McDonald or any other fast food place.

We went to this buffet during the state wrestling championship. I do believe that it is a great value, however My review is based on service as well as the cleanup crew. I took my five kids here Because they claimed to have sushi and sashimi as well as other Asian Delights. Food really was good, not how I expected. I don't really like buffets because the food is usually bland/plain and prepared in huge quantities with no personal touch. However this Asian food was similar to a fast food restaurant. The sashimi bar kept running out of salmon and tuna, and I would ask for them to replenish it. I saw a big piles of Artie prepped fish sitting on the counter, so I was not sure why they were not replenishing that fast. I do understand that seven of us were eating mostly so she me, so I gave an extra star for this. However about an hour before closing, they decided to start cleaning the floors. There was this huge horrible chlorine smell that start making us nauseous as we were trying to eat. Also the bucket water had a specific smell that you only smell when it's not changed often enough. I'm not sure how they figure that it's OK to sanitize the floors with smelly water while customers are sitting in booth next to the cleaner. 


I will go back to this place, however I will make sure it's early enough to miss the inconsiderate buckets of chlorine.

We tried this buffet as part of a Chinese tour we hopped on from LA to Antelope Canyon. It was just okay. Not great, but edible. Even though it's decent, everything is very salty and dry. Even the fruits tasted dry. There are definitely better buffet places out there than this one, and if we had a choice we would probably skip this place. However, it was our only option on the tour because the guides have to take us to a Chinese buffet as 90% of passengers were Chinese tourists who only want to eat at these types of places.

This place is cash only, but if there is low demand, they take in credit card holders for a fee.

Parking is free and plenty because it is in a plaza with other businesses nearby.

This place was once a great p place to eat. Now, no matter which location I tried over several months, the food is just bad. Nothing like the variety and taste of years past. It tastes bland or full of garlic. Chow mein is mushy and they don't serve the dishes that they once did. 

I kept hoping it would taste like the old days.  No more tries! I guess it's why they keep closing locations.

We came here on a Saturday evening, a little before 8pm, and had their dinner buffet for 
31.54 (Used a 15% off dinner coupon that I received in the mail) 

- Right before we walked in 2 Asian men came out arguing about Lobster! Literally, "Let's take this outside!" Hot commodity. YES! 
- Pay before you eat like a casino buffet. 
Items to grab a second time
1. salmon sashimi 
2. Lobster - like at a dim sum restaurant
3. Prawns - like at Makinos
4. Crab legs 
- Disorganized seating. 
- Like most Asians, you come for the seafood. They do have the normal Chinese buffet food and the sushi rolls that no one gets. Fillers. 
- No dim sum. No tempura. 
- Oysters taste just like the sea...yuck. Good thing they have lemons and chili paste.
- Exactly what I expected. Great food, sloppy venue. If you can get over that, then you'll have a wonderful time. 
- Full-filling. Cheap. No dates. Family + Bring GM+GF type of place. You challenge yourself to AYCE, then leave with that  greasy upset stomach feeling. haha

This place has no customer service at all! Waited at the Mongolian BBQ station to order, rang the bell as the sign said! No one came around! There was a guy making sushi there but just looked at me never said nothing! This is last time I come here!
Good food, well priced but tables are old and restrooms are dirty. Needs polish up!!
I do like this place!!! Only thing is sometimes its abit salty but WOW is it good~
Even the Chinese buffet in Chadron, Nebraska was better than this. Don't even be tempted.

If I could give this 0 stars I would. Do NOT waste your money here. My boyfriend and I would come here understanding it isn't a gourmet style strip buffet...but the food is not anywhere near fresh and will make you sick. Also, their customer service is horrible....hor i ble.

Let me first start off by saying we went on a Sunday around 1 pm and it was very very busy. We had to wait to be seated and once it was time for us to go through the buffet line it was a mad house. It was so busy that the staff couldn't fill some of the popular items fast enough. The food was ok I wouldn't say it was amazing but it truly is like any other Chinese buffet you go to. The part  that concerned me was the cleanliness of this place. The floors are filthy, there are sticky spots to the floor and the tables felt sticky as well. My sushi roll had a piece of plastic wrapper on it as well. The only thing I would recommend they do is to get on their staff to clean instead of standing around.

Ate here on my last trip to Vegas and i was surprised by this place. I'm not a fan of Asian buffets like Todai and such but i actually like this one. We came mid-afternoon on a Friday and we had no wait to get seated. The food was fresh and they had a wide variety of food that covered all of the Asian cuisine's.  This will be added to places i must eat at when i return to LV in the future.

You really gotta mess up to get one of these ratings from me but I've given up on these guys and all of their locations. After wasting $200 at this place, there's really no reason to return, for any aspect. The food, service, and atmosphere have all declined. Hopefully I can keep you from making the same mistake also.

The last time we were at this location was probably four or five months ago and things seemed OK. Since then, they've taken a nose dive and they're heading for a crash landing. Things were bad from the start when the super personable woman up front greeted us first with, "how many?" After tallying the head count at 13, she asked "how many drinks?" I was about to say 13, but stopped and asked if they were free and she said they weren't and were $1.50 each. What buffet does that crap for soft drinks?

The Mongolian grill is gone. They sushi stand was ransacked and looked like I fell into after drinking a 12 pack. They time stamp the sushi and saw some pieces that were there since 3:30 PM and it almost 8 when we were there. Pretty much all of the food was old and dried out with no attempt to replace any of it. Their one saving grace has been their crab legs, but my wife gave up on them after one trip because they were overcooked with no meat. My brother-in-law didn't finish his meal because he was getting an upset stomach from eating the chicken wings. Service was terrible for a buffet. Thirteen people are gonna go through plates pretty quick and they were piled up like we were having a tower building contest.

I could go on and on, but I'm not going to waste my time or yours writing, or even uploading photos. Just trust if you look at my rating distribution, no business gets this unless they truly deserve it.

You know people talk about this place but you have to come in person to see it is not like people said,i went today for lunch and i eat a littel Sushi, jalapeño Srimp and couple others items, was pritty good and for a quik lunch you choises there, grab eat littel bed of everything Telapia whith ginger Slice bambo black musroom n carrots n Ginger that was good The jalapeño Srimp was good too, four diferent soups plus diferent salds in overall yes go and try it is all right any way in the only best all u can eat in Vegas

So, I pretty much go here every time I'm in Vegas with my incredibly large family, and this is because it's probably one of the cheapest buffets around.

Prices vary depending on age and height (or something like that).  Unfortunately, I didn't pay much attention to the prices because I didn't have to pay.  Har har.

Let's see here ... the food is pretty good I guess.  Nothing extraordinary and nothing that disgusts me.  I'm a vegetarian so there weren't many options for me.  I ate the Chow Mein, Saunteed Mushrooms, Fried String Beans with Garlic.  Furthermore, a couple of chocolate strawberries, fruit, and pastries. All of those were okay.  It didn't blow me away ... at all.

The place looks rather nice outside; I wouldn't say the same for the inside.  It doesn't look too clean.  Actually, I can put up with the look, but it's not exactly attractive.

So to sum things up; it's average. Call it a plain jane place if you want.

We walked in and I was hit by the aroma of grease. I remembered years ago when my old roommate came home after eating out with his family. He walked by me and he smelled awful! I asked him where he came from and he said they had dinner at the Buffet @ Asia. I said " Dude, you stink.... like you've been working in a kitchen all day".

Ever since that evening, I've never had the desire to dine there. But then a few nights ago when my boyfriend and I were in the area, we decided to give this place a try. We said that if there's a line then we'll move on, but nope, there was no line. It was actually pretty empty inside. 

I only tried a few of their items, one of them being the beef and broccoli, and the beef was chewy. The chicken skewer and orange chicken were actually good. They served lobster that night and I took a small piece which only made me want more, it was good. I had a little bit of the pad Thai and it was just OK.  I also tried their donut which wasn't too bad. Not too much flavor, it tasted like fried dough that you would get at a fair.

I think we stayed for about 45 minutes, I was worried if we had stayed longer then I would unintentionally be wearing Buffet Eau de Parfum.

Yeah some people from my hometown in sac ask, " Dude, you live in Vegas go to a real buffet." This is a real buffet. I am tired of the casino, Gordons fishstick buffets. The one thing that really amazed me, is included in the cost of the buffet $12 you can order Thai Iced Tea Complete with Boba... The food is awesome, the service was fast friendly and the food was Great and did not taste like boxed frozen Oscar Myer Corndogs.
Bad service, horrible attitude, day old food, didn't refill water machine, weak foam plates that bend when food is on it, plastic utensils.

there are day this place is really good, and there are day this place is just plain awful! it's a hit or miss, but as far as Asian Buffet, it's a lot better than most other Asian Buffets i been to. One other thing, watch out for family with little kids, they run around and screaming like crazy, not ideal for a date night

I just found out about this place last week. After our ob/gyn department tour at St. Rose, I asked a fellow classmate about any local boba/milk tea places in the area. She suggested this place, since they had pretty good seafood and boba. I decided to try it out for myself with my classmates. For dinner, it only cost us $13. The place is pretty small when you walk in, but there is another eating area in the back. The food selection is somewhat varied. They have a small section for different soups, sushi, a grill area where you can get korean style ribs, seafood and beef cooked to your taste, dim sum, vegetables, and seafood, of course! I didn't get a chance to taste the lobster, since many people grab those first, and I didn't want to wait for them to make more...I love the spinach and the soy sauce/ginger fish they have. They have a mediocre dessert section (what do you expect from Asian buffets?), and I usually just get their almond jello fruit medley and coconut/orange jellos. Don't worry, they have the frozen yogurt machine, if all else fails! 

The sushi is pretty fresh (mostly the salmon!). It's pretty cheap for what you get here, and I probably will take my parents here when they come visit. Warning: any food that is wasted will get charged.

In reality, I would only give this place 3 stars, but since they have all you can drink tapioca drinks (TARO MILK TEA!) that are pretty good, as well as Thai ice teas, included in their buffet....I'm going to give them 4 stars!

My family went there for dinner for the first time tonight and it was a TERRIBLE experience. The service and the overall presentation of the restaurant were decent. The food, however, was so bad that everyone got a stomach ache. I think we all had food poisoning. The food was also either bland or very salty. We did not try the Mongolian grill section, so I cannot speak on behalf of that. Will I go back, no.

2.5 stars. 
I walked into this place knowing exactly what to expect - cheap, greasy Chinese food that will get you full. It was a weekend night, and all the nicer Las Vegas buffets had too long of a wait time for me to want to stand in line. I was hungry, and could pretty much eat anything after spending the entire day hiking in Death Valley.

Most of the food was decent; dishes are filled with MSG and oil but it's still tasty. There was a pretty good selection and you really can't go wrong when the tab is around $12-13 for dinner.

I took my seven year old brother here last night (12/27/10) for a sister-brother date. My dinner was $12.99 and his was $6.99 for the kid's price. We were seated at a booth and went to town - sort of. 

Maybe it's just me, but I'd like to see more non-seafood options for dinner. I'm not one to pile a plate 13 inches deep with crab legs and shrimp to chow down. I did like the neon orange honey shrimp and the seafood stuffing, served on a scallop shell, but wished they offered more non-seafood choices. 

My little brother tried sushi for the first time (didn't like it) and a frog leg. I told him it was chicken and he said that he liked it until it "started to taste like seafood." He was a big fan of the baby corn in the seafood medley. He was quite worried about cleaning his plate because he saw a sign that said that if food was wasted, there'd be an extra charge. We only took tablespoons of this and that, so it wasn't a problem. 

The ice cream machine was out for almost all of dinner. We had the coconut jello which was good, and the rest of the desserts were ok. The candied nuts were decent. When the vanilla ice cream light went on, there was a big line for the ice cream - I got up to help my brother, as I had done the entire night, and our waiter completely cleared our table, like we left! We were seriously 6 ft away! My brother was a little upset because we had been hiding scallop shells in a napkin to take home and they got thrown away so we snuck two more out when we sat back down.

In addition to our table being cleared in the middle of dinner, nobody ever came to ask if we needed refills or anything. We were ignored the entire time by the staff. I had to ask for a water when our plates were cleared because they pretended like we weren't there. We were chewing on ice almost the entire night. 

I've had good Asian buffets and bad ones, and this one is about middle of the road in terms of quality. I had to knock it down one star for service.

I definitely would not recommend this buffet.

Price was $15 during dinner, which is outrageously expensive because the selection wasn't good for the price and the food tasted terrible. There was not one dish that I enjoyed here.

I had a really hard time enjoying this place. It looks and feels dirty. Flies flying around the food.

So to summarize.. EXPENSIVE, BAD SELECTION FOR $$$$, BAD QUALITY, DIRTY...

I have no idea why some people would rate this place highly...they are either associated with Buffet @ Asia or they have been fed dog food their whole lives. Seriously.

STAY AWAY...YOU WILL REGRET THIS PLACE IF YOU GO HERE..TRUST ME.

Waitress was nice, price decent for having snow crabs and sushi available.  When you walk in and look up on the wall their is a big red sign that says "3 and under free."  When the bill came to the table,   we were charged for our 3 year old.  When we walked up to pay and asked the cashier, she replied that the "waitress measures her and tells us."
Huh??  Then she pointed to the wall and pointed at the 3'.   I guess I missed it.  I didn't realize it was 3 "feet" and under.  (Which my daughter stood up against their wall and went above the 3 because of her ponytail.). Ya know, because here in AMERICA it's usually the AGE AND UNDER.
So when I asked again about the price she made it sound like the waitress had to come over and measure again.  ??  The very rude cashier took my husbands card and swiped it.  When I asked what was going on,  she flipped out, got very loud and  told us we don't have to come back if we don't
 want.   We won't.  Very unprofessional.  Go back to your village.

If you're looking for a great Asian style seafood buffet, this place is it! Once you've tried Todai and the Rio's Seafood Buffet, give this place a shot and I don't think you'll want to go back to either place for a seafood buffet ever again. I actually like it better than Todai and the Rio. It's got a better selection of food and it's half the price. Albeit the décor isn't as nice as the other two places, but I would trade a nicely decorated place for better food any day. The quality of the food is slightly better at Todai and the Rio, however it's not twice the price better, it maybe only be $2 - 3 better. 

This place has got you covered with a little bit of Chinese, Thai, Korean, Mongolian BBQ, dim sum, and a decent sushi bar (the freshness is a bit hit and miss towards the end of the night, but spectacular at lunch). Dinner gives you a selection of lobster, snow crab, mussels, oysters, fried shrimp, fried scallops, and so much more. 

Since this place is off the strip, you also don't have to wait in the long lines. The servers are quite attentive, they will take plates almost as soon as you are done with it and I never quite saw the bottom of my glass. 

This is our go to place when we were living in Las Vegas and had out of town guests that wanted a buffet. They've never been disappointed. 

I'd technically rather give this place a 4.5 star because the ambiance isn't all that great, but this place deserves better than a 4, so I'm going with a 5 star.

Ya know its an asian buffet.
It had frog legs! I like weird stuff like that.
I didnt expect this to be a gourmet buffet. It is what it is.
The sushi did not have too many to choose from, but they did have octopus and that made me very happy. 
Crab is ok.  Whenever a new dish of it is put out it gets picked through like a pack of wild vultures attacked it.
The deserts are really good, all the little jellos and the coconut squares of jelly.
Octopus and frog legs.

Worst buffet I've ate in, would not recommend , crab legs no flavor and have no meat, server ZOE with a horrible attitude, I would 1000x recommend Hibachi Buffet at Stewart and Nellis, I promise it worth the drive!!!

Let me start off by saying the FOOD WAS GREAT, Customer servicev was very nice, no complaints my Husband and I  Live in Henderson and well there's not a lot of Chinese buffets around here so my husband and I have to drive down town to get to Krazy buffet where we usually go we never thought we'd find anything close to it taste wise, and quality wise  but we were wrong Buffet @ Asia is 5 stars in my book my husband loved it here as well as I. They have a big selection of different kinds of food and the best part is the sushi it taste fresh the waiters were very nice didn't let our cups get empty at all My Husband and I will be back soon that's for sure.

Too dirty and their menu is now litterally like 5 items. Will not go to this location any longer. i gave it 4 or 5 tries and just keeps getting worse. I don't expect to use the restroom or clean tables but this time the food all smelled foul and god forbid they turn the ac on it is almost like they want you to either pass out or leave real quick. I understand you make cuts for buffets but my god either increase the price and fill it with edible shit or close. Literally every single thing tasted the same or same sauce. i am not sure if they got just one walk or what but all of the stuff had similar nasty shitty seasoning. I don't even fuck with the sushi so i got no idea if that's safe or how it tastes.

Get ready... 1, 2, 3, BARF. This place is the WORST buffet I have ever been to. I don't why everyone gives them all these stars. Yes the selection is vast, but the quality is poor. The stir fry is a joke and tastes horrid. The beef and broccoli tastes 3 days old and the lobster claws were soggy and disgusting. It is an overstatement to say that this place is good in any way. The sushi at this buffet is so disgusting, the salmon sashimi they offer at the sushi station is so watery and tasteless. I really hope I don't get food poisoning from eating that. Once again, the food sucks hardcore, the service is good and the staff is friendly. If you think this is good in any way you must have burned off your taste buds. HORRIBLE.

Went here for lunch one afternoon. I have to say it was one of the worst places I've ever been to. It was so dirty! There was food crumbs all over the seats and tables, a dirty mop leaning against a table, and dirty rags on a couple tables, the rags were black! It had a weird smell, and the customer service was terrible! I will never go back.

This place is perfect if you are craving various Asian food. It's super affordable. 

Not a big fan of their space because it's very tight and you could barely move about if the place is busy. Their bathroom is the ever typical Asian restaurant bathroom- like no one ever checks up if it is dirty or if the toilets are clogged! 

Food is okay- too much mono-sodium if you ask me. Some food are just completely tasteless and dry- like their ribs. Most of food are just okay and filling. I'm a fan of their fried frogs and salt-and-pepper pork. 

I've had times where the servers are super attentive and friendly, but there are times where you just get snobby ones. So it depends. Overall, this place is very filling and affordable. Don't forget to try out their $1.99 boba slush- especially the strawberry one!

this place was soo good... THAT I PASSED OUT!!! hahahaha

there are a lot of food choices... for a really low price... there is something about vegas and all the good cheap food there... lol 

walnut shrimp is so good...

I happen to be on a quest of reviewing all of the most of the asian buffetts while in vegas.  Likle most of them this one was not that good, but not that bad either,  They were one of the only was that offered Sashimi instead of just plain sushi.  They also have a stir fri bar where a cook will cook the items of your choice while you wait.  The food was about average.
The one let down was that the salad in the salad bar was warm and wilted.  I guess that most people do not go to a chinese buffett for salad, but since I am doing this everyday for almost three weeks, the inability to get any ruffage into my diet that day was dissapointing.  Plus it made me think if the salad was not being kept at the proper temperature what else might be amiss.

I normally love Asia Buffet.  But this location is the WORST.  All the food was dried out underneath those heat lamps. The service was horrible.  We placed an order for the custom made noodles and the guy didn't bring them to us until we were about to leave.  I was so disappointed.  It was not clean.  It was very disappointing.
THE WORST CHINESE BUFFET IN LAS VEGAS!!! The food selection is horrible, place is dirty and workers have no customer service skills. Now they serve food on paper plates... Are you kidding me!?!

I  used to go there years ago.  I went a few months ago and it SUCKED. It looked dirty, the help was rude and the food was pretty disgusting.   I was really embarrassed because I took someone who had never been there before.
I'm a bit surprised that this place hasn't been totally closed down. A real waste of money

I was trying to walk around the restaurant to find out what they provide before I actually sit down and eat. The waitress and manager prohibited me from doing so. They asked me to pay at first to walk around. How can I make decision whether I should eat before looking at what they serve? Most other buffet allows me to do so, the worst case is they ask me just walk a little bit. And this restaurant totally disallowed me to do so.
